PAD_DeadGuide.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadGuide.text: The githyanki from the mind flayer ship. A shame he didn't survive.

session_synopses.PAD_DeadGuide: PAD for when players get closer to the alternative guide's corpse at the crash site. The guide is a gith mage the replaces Lae'zel in the tutorial introduction if Lae'zel is an avatar (he knows Lae'zel). After tutorial ends and players wake up, his corpse will appear nearby (he didn't get magically saved when falling).

PAD_ShadowheartComment.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartComment.text: Those people... the mind flayer made them its puppets.

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartComment: Shadowheart realises that some people encountered near the nautiloid crash are being enthralled by an injured mind flayer and have no control over their actions.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you wake, the tadpole squirms in your skull.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Orient yourself - where did you land?

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The chaos of the crash site confuses the landscape. You'll need to find a settlement or landmark.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances around general surrounds.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *And you'll need to do it quickly.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The tadpole is a death sentence, and the clock is ticking. You need a cure.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Concerned expression

session_synopses: This is the dialogue each avatar gets when they wake up on the beach in WLD_Main_A Crash site.It's a call to action to find a solution for the tadpole before you turn into a mindflayer.

session_synopses.AD_Rock: A player passes by a hidden Harper cache. If they pass a Perception check, they discover the rock hiding the cache. Otherwise, they just comment on the nearby ocean view.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your skull throbs, your muscles ache. Memories of the last day swim through your head before taking form.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'Zel solo scene, custom cameras may be required.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Rub your forehead. Can you feel the tadpole, wriggling inside?

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Inside you, an atrocity is growing - feeding on you, becoming you.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *It's only a matter of days before tentacles split your lips, and your skin turns to gore.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *If you want a cure, you must follow protocol: locate a githyanki crèche.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *There, you will find your kin. The tadpole will be removed, and you will be purified.*

session_synopses: Laezel wakes up and reflects on what she needs to do after the crash. Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht: VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het.

Dead.speaker: Abducted Nobleman
Dead.text: Guiding my cart... shadow fell... tentacle grabbed me...

Dead.speaker: Abducted Nobleman
Dead.text: Took me here... put something in my eye...

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a merchant, who was kidnapped by the mindflayers and died in the crash. The player can offer to help bury the body or perform any last rites, but they'll be rebuked by the spirit.

PAD_FirstIntellectDevourerCombat.speaker: Player
PAD_FirstIntellectDevourerCombat.text: Better stay back. One strike could be lethal.

session_synopses.PAD_FirstIntellectDevourerCombat: Start of a player's turn. The first time this player (and nearby players, if any) are in combat with Intellect Devourers. Intellect Devourers are lethal at close range. Keep in mind player might be alone.

node_data.text: CinematicNodeContext: ~Nautiloid arrives in Faerun
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Nautiloid arrives in Faerun

Mind Flayer Pilot reacts to player falling out of ship
[Player] falls unconscious from the nautiloid

PAD_Return.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Return.text: Dead goblins over there. Worth checking for supplies maybe.

PAD_Door.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Door.text: Won't get that open easily. Maybe there's another entrance.

session_synopses.PAD_Return: Arriving at a juncture in a path, companion Shadowheart points out an opportunity to look for supplies.
session_synopses.PAD_Door: Shadowheart comments as a companion on another character trying to open the exterior door to Jergal's crypt.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: You'll die a bloody pauper unless you take a few risks.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Why don't we just wait a while? Make sure it's safe.

VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.text: There! Not so impregnable after all.
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.context: NodeContext: Satisfied. She's just successfully lockpicked a large, heavy set of doors.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Warryn
BanditWestInteraction.text: You! Not another step, hear me?
BanditWestInteraction.context: NodeContext: Sharp ultimatum mixed with a little surprise. Found the player approaching from the side of the structure.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Warryn
BanditWestInteraction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hollering down to Gimblebock, his leader (down some steps behind Warryn, out of view).NodeContext: Hollering down to Gimblebock, his leader (down some steps behind Warryn, out of view)

BanditWestInteraction.text: CinematicNodeContext: Alerted by Warryn, Gimblebock hurries up to confront the player
BanditWestInteraction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Alerted by Warryn, Gimblebock hurries up to confront the player

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: What's this then - trying to creep around us and loot the crypt? Not happening.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: Or is it the ship you're after? Don't matter either way - it's ours, all of it.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction.text: I mean no harm - I'm just looking around.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: First you look, then you touch, then you take!
BanditWestInteraction.context: NodeContext: He's not happy with the player saying they're just looking around, and he's going to attack soon.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: The only thing we're sharing with you is our pointy ends - get 'em!
BanditWestInteraction.context: NodeContext: He's going to attack the player, who just said they were just looking around.

session_synopses.AD_BanditsDiscussion: Discussion between Gimbleboc and Taman before the scene against them triggers. They're arguing about whether to investigate the crash (this segues into the beginning of their intertactive dialogue when you get near enough)
session_synopses.VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe: Shadowheart lockpicked the crypt door that she usually try to bash.
session_synopses.AD_BanditReaction: A bandit exclaims in alarm/indignity upon spotting the player 'trespassing' near a tomb they intended to loot.
session_synopses.VB_Fissure_1: The player notices a gap in the flooring of an ancient chapel. There's faint signs of something else below.
session_synopses.BanditWestInteraction: Alternate version of the confrontation scene between Gimblebock and his bandits at the crypt - triggers if the player approaches the scene from the side, alerting Warryn first.
session_synopses.Bandit_Melee_01_Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Gimblebock - the leader of the bandits who're looting the ruined chapel near where the player first wakes up. Gimblebock's answers are fragmented, cryptic. He can only draw on info that he knew when he was alive, and will refuse to speak to his killer if he recognises them. After a maximum of five questions, he'll fall silent for good.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.text: Eyes on the toad-freak. We can't risk it escaping.

AD_TieflingsLeaving.speaker: Damays
AD_TieflingsLeaving.text: Observe - and listen. You'll hear goblins before you see them.

AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.text: They must have carried something useful.

AD_OpenCage1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_OpenCage1.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

AD_LaeZelDead.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead.text: Hold it together. We've got to finish what we started.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: Of course it's dangerous. One of them carved up Zorru's whole squad.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: And let the goblins have it?

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: No. We take it to the grove.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_LeavingAnyCombat1.text: I can't stay here. It's too dangerous.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: Zorru was right. Yellow as a toad, and twice as ugly.
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Nymessa
TieflingsScene.text: The thing's dangerous. Leave it for the goblins to kill.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: And if it escapes? How will you - Oh! A guest.
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tieflings notice you in the middle of their conversation.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene.text: *Your skull aches before you can take a step - and you are the creature. You feel her irritation and indignity.*

TieflingsScene.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene.text: *And you feel answers. She knows more about your condition.*

TieflingsScene.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene.text: Shoot the trap down. We must kill it before it harms someone.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: They're right. No one's safe if that thing goes loose.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: Enough. Lower the trap. Ready your blade.

LaezelDead.speaker: Nymessa
LaezelDead.text: Th-thank you. I couldn't have done it without you.

LaezelDead.speaker: Nymessa
LaezelDead.text: But I've got to go. I need to check out that blast.

LaezelDead.speaker: Player
LaezelDead.text: A blast? Care to be more specific?

LaezelDead.speaker: Nymessa
LaezelDead.text: You didn't hear it? Shook our camp good, so I came for a look.

AD_EscortStart.speaker: Damays
AD_EscortStart.text: Hold it still - I'll tie it up.

AD_EscortStart.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_EscortStart.text: You expect a githyanki to surrender? Imbeciles.

session_synopses.AD_LaezelReactsToAttack: Lae'zel is in the cage. The player attacked her.
session_synopses.AD_ReturnAnyCombat2: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Damays plays this AD when the combat ends, while he returns to the cage.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsLeaving: Two tieflings discussing goblins, who might be nearby.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses: Damays and Nymessa are dead. Lae'zel says this once, then will inspect the corpses.
session_synopses.AD_OpenCage1: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelDead: Two tieflings that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comment that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro: Two tieflings argue about what to do with Lae'zel. Nymessa thinks to leave her alone. Damays wants to take her back to camp.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelDeadSolo2: A tiefling that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comments that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_OtherDied2: Damays reacts to the death of nymessa at Lae'zel recruitment.
session_synopses.AD_LeavingAnyCombat1: |Tieflings joined a random combat and were dragged far from Lae'zel Recruitment. They will leave out of stage while saying this instead of going back to the scene.|
session_synopses.TieflingsScene: You come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).
session_synopses.LaezelDead: You helped two tieflings kill a strange creature. (Lae'zel.) You talk to them, and they tell you about a blast they heard. (The ship crash.)
session_synopses.AD_OpenCageLaezel: Lae'zel is still hanging in her cage. She calls to you to let her down.
session_synopses.AD_EscortStart: Tieflings have shot down Lae'zel from her cage thinking the would tie her up and take her to the grove. They shoul dhave thought it through. Lae'zel is not going quietly.

VB_LowerFloor_1.speaker: Player
VB_LowerFloor_1.text: This place wasn't built for the living.
VB_LowerFloor_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's enjoying exploring here.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.text: They didn't want to surrender their valuables, even after death.

VB_SideChamber_1.speaker: Player
VB_SideChamber_1.text: Looks like someone wanted to bury their secrets.

AD_BanditGuardWarning.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardWarning.context: NodeContext: He's in an abandoned chapel, looting, and has just spotted the players. He calls to his friends for help and enters combat

AD_JergalInsideTomb.speaker: Richly Adorned Sarcophagus
AD_JergalInsideTomb.text: Dost thou think to rush fate? See to the dead first.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.text: Rotten food, dusty altars... where's the bloody treasure?
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself

AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.context: NodeContext: spotted the player - shouting to alert her companions as she becomes hostile

PAD_GasPit.speaker: Player
PAD_GasPit.text: I can't see any way to disarm it.

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in an adjacent room just collapsed, startling them

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter.text: The roof caved in - this place is a deathtrap!
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound, this guy is trying to take control of the situation and calm his companions

VB_Skeleton_1.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_1.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.context: NodeContext: alarmed - he's a tomb-robber in an abandoned chapel, and the players just surprised him. He's calling his friends to help as combat begins

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.text: How'd you get past Andorn? Back off!
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.context: NodeContext: She was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel and is surprised to see the players who have either killed or sneaked past her friend 'Andorn'. She's entering combat.

AD_BanditGuardSurprised.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player just entered, surprising him. He calls for help as he backs away, in combat

VB_Artefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_Artefact_1.text: A lot of effort to hide one sarcophagus.
VB_Artefact_1.context: NodeContext: Said with reverence and a touch of fear.

VB_Sanctum_1.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_1.text: No more prayers... only silence and dust.
VB_Sanctum_1.context: NodeContext: player reflects on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel. Possibly quietly reverential; it's a holy place

AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.speaker: Player
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.text: No lock, no handle. How does it open?
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.context: NodeContext: found a door without a lock or handle

PAD_FoundCoins.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundCoins.text: A strange coin. I wonder what it's worth.

AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.text: Not even sure this is a door.
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.context: NodeContext: Confused - trying to unlock a door in an abandoned chapel that doesn't actually have a lock. She's struggling and muttering to herself

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: I wonder what was so subversive about their words that they commanded protection.
VB_Skeleton_2.context: NodeContext: player reacts to companion commenting that skeletons in an abandoned chapel appear to have died without a fight. Slightly unnerved

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: This place is falling apart - could've happened by itself.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Haseid
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: No such thing as coincidences when there's loot to be had.

Jergal.text: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player
Jergal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: So he has spoken, and so thou standest before me. Right as always.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: What a curious way to awaken.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Now I have a question for thee: what is the worth of a single mortal's life?

Jergal.speaker: Player
Jergal.text: A peaceful undead. Interesting. Why aren't you attacking me?

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Dull your weapons as you wish.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.text: It's... open? Could've sworn I hadn't cracked it.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.text: Oh, hells. Something just woke up...
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.context: NodeContext: just picked up an artefact and heard something awakening in response down in a dungeon - afraid, but with resolve

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: I know when I've got a lock beaten and I didn't beat this one.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: Maybe it just broke by itself. This place is ancient.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.context: NodeContext: Further weak effort at explaining the unexplainable.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: Maybe. But keep on your guard.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Something doesn't add up.

AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.text: Hells! Something's coming out of the crypt!
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.context: NodeContext: Terrified - we just emerged from a seemingly abandoned crypt she was trying to break into

PAD_JergalStatueReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_JergalStatueReaction.text: That statue. It seems they worshipped some kind of... scholar?

AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.text: Barton? Oh gods, somebody killed Barton!
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.context: NodeContext: just found a dead friend - Barton - and is furious as she starts to hunt for the killer

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.text: No more prayers... only dust and silence.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.text: Who were those prayers for? Normally the patron god is obvious - not here.

session_synopses.VB_LowerFloor_1: This triggers has the player unlocks a door and enters a secret and, until now, hidden crypt.
session_synopses.PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing: Voicebark dialog after robbing the amulet from Jergal chapel, about whether it was right to loot the place. Its guardians might have been killed by the player. Or the guardians might have engaged the player, but they found a way to get out without killing them all, by fleeing or distracting them. Or the player might have sneakily escape the guardians.This is played on the party after they leave an area, so Speakers are roughly interchangeable here, the undertaking is assumed to be a party effort.
session_synopses.VB_SideChamber_1: VB upon noticing the book chained and padlocked to the table in the side room.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardWarning: A bandit who is part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - at this point, he's seen the players entering the chapel - 'the uninvited guests' - and thinks they're after the same loot as his crew. He's calling his friends to help.
session_synopses.AD_JergalInsideTomb: Jergal reacts to a player touching his sarcophagus when his servants (the skeletal clerics) have not yet been killed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSearching: A bandit in an abandoned chapel who is searching around an altar for a way to open a passage into the crypt, which is in the corridor outside. He's frustrated, twitchy and nervous. This place is creepy.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked: A bandit in an abandoned chapel calls to her companions for help upon spotting the player
session_synopses.PAD_GasPit: Player characters comment when the player interacts with a trap that has been spotted but not yet triggered
session_synopses.AD_BanditCrashBanter: A group of bandits in an abandoned chapel - they're hoping to loot the place and are a little on edge. Abandoned chapels often have traps or undead guardians. they're startled by a loud noise from one of the side-chambers. The roof just caved in, and the bandit are trying to figure out a plan of action. What they don't know is that the roof collapse was caused by the players who just broke in.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_1: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardCallHelp: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel. He's twitchy and on edge, and now he's in a fight and needs his friends.
session_synopses.PAD_ButtonBlocked: The player has pressed a button only to find it won't move - because it deactivates a trap they haven't triggered yet.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting: A bandit who was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel - at this point, she's seen the players intruding on her position and tries to alert her friends as she enters combat
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardSurprised: A bandit guarding the door to an abandoned chapel that his crew are looting. The player just surprised him and he calls for help as he enters combat
session_synopses.VB_Artefact_1: Players notice the tomb containing the Selune artefact.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_1: players reflect on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel
session_synopses.AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation: player finds a door that has no lock or handle
session_synopses.PAD_FoundCoins: Player finds a soul coin inside Jergal's chapel.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking: A bandit in an abandoned chapel - she's trying and failing to open a door to the lower level of the chapel, searching for loot. Talking to herself as she struggles - confused by the fact the door doesn't have a lock.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_2: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert: Three bandits - Barton, Mari and Haseid - are on alert in a crypt they're attempting to rob. They heard a commotion (falling masonry) and are braced for threats.
session_synopses.Jergal: After the party has slain a group of undead scholars, the judge of death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor: Mari realises that the door she was trying to unlock is suddenly opened, but she has not unlocked it.
session_synopses.VB_TakingTheArtefact_1: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room...
session_synopses.AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter: Mari has found the door to lower level open but she did not unlock it. She talks to her comrade, Barton about it.They debate what must have happened.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised: Players emerge from a seemingly abandoned crypt, startling a bandit on the other side of the door. Afterward, the bandit attacks.
session_synopses.PAD_JergalStatueReaction: Player succeeds/fails passive check to recognise statue of Jergal.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit: A bandit in an abandoned chapel finds one of her companions dead
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart: Players have entered an abandoned chapel dedicated to an unknown god. Shadowheart is puzzled as to why she can't figure out who was the patron of this place.

PAD_Jewelry.speaker: Player
PAD_Jewelry.text: Necklace has a Harper sigil. Why were they here?

session_synopses.PAD_Jewelry: Player finds a necklace at the watchtower. If they pass a History check, they recognize it as belonging to the Harpers. If they encountered the Harper documents hidden in the CRA cave, the player senses a pattern.

AD_OutsideStatue.speaker: Player
AD_OutsideStatue.text: Text is too faded. Doesn't tell me who was worshipped here.
AD_OutsideStatue.context: NodeContext: Players with religious classes comment on the plaque.

PAD_RichSarcophagus.speaker: Narrator
PAD_RichSarcophagus.text: *Here lies the Guardian of Tombs. Through knowledge comes atonement.*
PAD_RichSarcophagus.context: NodeContext: Reading the inscription on a sarcophagus.

AD_SqueletonRoom.speaker: Player
AD_SqueletonRoom.text: I've never seen this language before. Who was worshipped here?
AD_SqueletonRoom.context: NodeContext: Selûne pronounced seh-LOON-eh. Reading a plaque in a slightly mocking tone before adding some displeased commentary.

session_synopses.AD_OutsideStatue: The player tries to read a bronze plaque at the foot of an unidentified statue.
session_synopses.PAD_RichSarcophagus: Player reads the inscription on a plaque in an abandoned chapel dedicated to the god Jergal.
session_synopses.AD_SqueletonRoom: The player reads a bronze plaque at the feet of a mysterious statue

Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.speaker: Za'krug
Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.text: I'll bleed every last one of you!

DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolTampered.text: The Idol of Silvanus! Round up the intruders - we've been patient enough.

RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Kanon
RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.text: VO_SFX: Death cry - While turning the wheel to open the gate, Kanon gets hit by an arrow in the neck and dies

RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Remira
RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.text: VO_SFX description: Heavy lifting efforts to try to keep gate open (along with Aradin & Barth). It's too heavy so the gate slams shut

CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.speaker: GROUP_Civilians, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Guards, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Tiefling
CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.text: The goblin is escaping! Kill it!

session_synopses.DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolTampered: AD when the druids realise their sacred idol has been tampered with. This is the straw that breaks the camel's back, and they start attacking the tieflings and the players.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime: Assorted residents of the Druid Grove react to a goblin prisoner having broken free.

AD_Ritual.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Find our master. Return to me then.
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to the bird. NodeContext: Stern but also love in her voice. She knows the bird will do its best.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Tell me what you find. Tell only me. Understand?

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Tingmiaq
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping from foot NodeContext: Cheerful, excited.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: We wasted so much time fighting each other.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The danger has passed, but there was much infighting in the druid grove, which he believes put them at higher risk.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: Silvanus taught us a lesson by letting an outsider save us.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: Players are the outsider here - they saved the druid grove from both infighting and a goblin attack.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.text: You think you saved us? You just prolonged the inevitable.
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.text: Sooner or later, other outsiders will bring trouble to the grove.
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

AD_RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2.text: How could we be so blind?
AD_RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Karrik feel betrayed by Kagha.

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra... did I say that out loud?
RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Dazed. He's been chanting for days. Pronounced: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: We've been chanting for days. I need some rest.

BirdSender.speaker: Player
BirdSender.text: What were you saying to that bird?

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: The bird knows. She needs to know. You do not.

BirdSender.speaker: Player
BirdSender.text: I helped defend this grove - I'm not your enemy.

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: Not all enemies are outside our walls.

session_synopses.AD_BirdSender: |Druid sending a bird to find Halsin. |
session_synopses.AD_Ritual: Five druids participate in a ritual around a sacred pool. The chant will summon a coccoon of thorns that will encircle their entire grove. Lines play sequentially, each druid saying one line, then the next, etc.They're chanting at a normal to low volume. They're attempting to suss power out from the earth itself, but they're not forcing it out. There should be a loose rhythm to it (think Arwen from LoTR when she summons the river horses), but it shouldn't come across like a drum circle.
session_synopses.AD_SearchingBird: |Talking to her friend and companion, a bird. She wants it to fly over the area and search for her missing master, Halsin. |
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Kerrick is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Kerrick is furious - he feels betrayed by Kagha, and doesn't quite care if she's been killed.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Kerrick has calmed down a good bit - now that the danger's passed, he's seeing things with a bit more clarity. The player always encounters Kerrick around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid5: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Tahani is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Tahani is furious that players stopped the ritual - even though Kagha had ulterior motives, Tahani still believes her path was best and that players had no right to intervene.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Tahani isn't convinced the threat is really over. She thinks her fellow druids will lead them down the same path again, taking pity on people that will only bring trouble to their door.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool. She's more or less the xenophobic conservative of the chanting druids.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid2: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Kerrick was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Kerrick feels angry and betrayed - he thought he was part of something good when really he was being used.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Kerrick is reflective and calm. The threat is gone, but there's much to be learned from it.
session_synopses.RitualDruid1: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Aelar is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Aelar is in a daze - several days of chanting have left him a bit loopy.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Aelar is still exhausted, but he's gathered his senses, more or less. The player always encounters Aelar around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.BirdSender: This dialogue can take place in two different states. In the first, Apakusis is short and defensive. The grove's ranking leader, Kagha, has gathered support to close off the grove to outsiders with an intense ritual. She doesn't trust Kagha, and quietly despairs to see her grove turn to such measures.In the second state, the ritual has been stopped. She's shocked at the revelation that Kagha had been involved with Shadow Druids, and is having trouble accepting it.The player finds this druid speaking to a bird in the druid grove.

AD_1.speaker: Danis
AD_1.text: Hope the road isn't too bad.

session_synopses.AD_1: This will be Danis' AD if Bex is separated from him, possibly by being dead, possibly just by being occupied. He is a bit uneasy because of this, in any case.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

Trainee1.speaker: Umi
Trainee1.text: Oh! Uh... right. 'Go for the heart.'
Trainee1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.NodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.

AD_HideoutTrespass.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I don't have money or anything to sell. My p-partner does that.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_002.text: So what's your side of the business?

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I'm the guard? So... don't steal anything! I'm watching you!

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Sorry about the nest. You guys find anything good today?

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Nah. Everyone's got junk. Worse than junk.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Don't worry, kid. In Baldur's Gate, purses practically grow on trees.

AD_MerchantLeaves.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

HideoutGuard_002.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

CaughtThief.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief.text: *You suddenly feel something moving against your back and turn.*
CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief.speaker: Player
CaughtThief.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Child being shaken by player. She struggles free, and a few trinkets fall to the groundNodeContext: Scared and in pain

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Escapes the player's grasp, runs away.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Hey, you're back. Here to trade?

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Hey there. You wanna buy one of my lucky rings? Bargain magic at good prices.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001.text: Drop the act. I know about your little scam.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: That hurts. It's a great big scam.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: But okay, fine. Get out of here. Make room for the chumps.

AD_CannotFitCrack.speaker: Player
AD_CannotFitCrack.text: I can't fit through here. Wonder if there's another way in.

Trainee3.speaker: Gan
Trainee3.text: This is boring. We should train against real goblins!

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I saw you at the gates. You fight well.
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: All the trainees are getting added to the dialog on this nodeNodeContext: Teacher voice.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be includedNodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: They're just children - why are you teaching them to fight?

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: It's that or teach them to beg for their lives.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: The goblins will chase us to Baldur's Gate and these kids know it.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A warrior like you could lift their spirits.

Trainee2.speaker: Ide
Trainee2.text: Next time the goblins come, I'll be ready.

Trainee2.speaker: Wyll
Trainee2.text: Don't push it, kid. If you see trouble, then run. Only fight if you have to.

AD_Trespassing.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: The nerve of that smirking little rat.

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: I'll say this for those devils: they know how to throw a punch.

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: My mum gave me that locket on her godsdamned deathbed. The boy took the thing. I know it.

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo.text: Heirloom, is it? Been in your family long?

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo.text: Not much of an heirloom then... unless there's a tale behind it, maybe?

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: She stole it from a house she cleaned, all right?

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: They didn't pay her much. They owed her a perk or two.

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Player
Adventurer_Solo.text: Wherever it came from, at least it's something to remember her by.

Adventurer_Solo.speaker: Barth
Adventurer_Solo.text: Anyway, I should go. See you around.

AD_Trainee1Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee1Responses.text: Throat if you can. Wrist if you can't.

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader.text: We're going to own that town.

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_CannotFitCrack: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.
session_synopses.Trainee3: Tiefling child far too confident they can fight goblins next time, even when scared.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.
session_synopses.Trainee2: Tiefling child confident they can fight goblins next time they come.
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.Adventurer_Solo: Non-critpath. Takes place after the player resolves the confronation between this adventurer and the thiefling boy who stole the adventurer's necklace.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee1Responses: Training in self-defence with an adult. Umi is 8-9 years old and timid.
session_synopses.AD_TrainerLessons: A trainer speaking to children being taught to defend themselves in a makeshift outdoor training arena.

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.text: He didn't come back, did he? His smell is gone. He's gone...
Bear.context: NodeContext: Detecting the bear's panick and concern.

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.text: Master. He left with the weaponed two-legs. He said he'd be back.

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.text: But I can smell them - the weaponed ones. And I cannot smell him... he's not coming back...

Bear.speaker: Player
Bear.text: You look strong. Why not go after him?

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.text: No... the woods have gone dark. There's too many predators lately - and I was never the strong one.

session_synopses.Bear: The bear is worried and depressed because Halsin hasn't come back yet.

Captive.speaker: Findal
Captive.text: Oh, thank you, thank you. I thought I was going to die down here.
Captive.context: NodeContext: out of breath, words spilling out of him - he's just been rescued from goblins who were tormenting him

Captive.speaker: Player
Captive.text: I'm surprised the goblins didn't gut you on sight. Why didn't they?

Captive.speaker: Findal
Captive.text: They were asking questions - about a weapon.
Captive.context: NodeContext: confused, he doesn't know anything about this

Captive.speaker: Findal
Captive.text: I told them - the only weapons here are the ones the foulbloods brought.

Captive.speaker: Findal
Captive.text: I must tell the others what happened. Step careful - there are traps in these tunnels. And thank you again.
Captive.context: NodeContext: frantic - he's still getting his breath back after being attacked by goblins, and is preparing to leave

node_data.speaker: Warrior Gresh
node_data.text: Did some bleeding hearts show up to save the druid? I'll cut ya to pieces.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking

node_data.speaker: Warrior Gresh
node_data.text: Kill 'em!
node_data.context: NodeContext: shouting an order to other nearby goblins as he prepares to attack the player

AD_CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
AD_CapturedGoblin.text: They ain't as friendly as me. Not as clever either. Kill 'em.
AD_CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: sly, vicious on last two words

AD_Captive.speaker: Findal
AD_Captive.text: The little thieves would have picked the whole grove clean.
AD_Captive.context: NodeContext: muttering to himself as he searches through stolen goods

session_synopses.Captive: Slightly out of breath, recovering from panic.A druid who was held hostage by goblin intruders speaks to the players who freed him.
session_synopses: Reaction from Goblin Scouts if they're approached in the tunnels. They attack even if Sazza is present.
session_synopses.AD_Tracks: Player recognises goblin tracks and comments.
session_synopses.AD_CapturedGoblin: Sazza tells players to kill other goblins while she is being rescued from the grove
session_synopses.AD_Captive: ADs for druid scout when he returns to the tiefling kids' area and finds it full of stolen goods, after the tieflings are gone

Resting.speaker: Narrator
Resting.text: *The adventurer sleeps soundly, his breath steady, his wounds expertly bandaged.*

session_synopses.Resting: Small dialogue when you find Liam sleeping in the den after freeing him in the goblin camp.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Those goblins will rue the day they chose to tangle with this grove.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: You and I will do some good here - I can feel it.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Lia and Rolan would never admit it, but they'd take an arrow for the other. Also stab each other. Not sure what'll come first.
Brother.context: NodeContext: You have broken up a fight between Lia and Rolan more times than you can count. You're tone is light and friendly as you joke with the player.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Thanks for cutting in - there might have been more than words if you hadn't.
Brother.context: NodeContext: A big friendly smile - you are the most genuine of the group

session_synopses.Sister: This occurs after the argument betwen Lia and Rolan. Lia is still stewing after the fight. Opportunity to get to know her better and understand the group dynamics.
session_synopses.Brother: This dialog occurs after the argument between Lia and Rolan that Cal attempted to mediate. It's light and friendly, and mainly a chance for the player to get to know Cal.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: If it ain't the friendly drow. Thought you were with the goblins when you showed up at the gate.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Glad you weren't - you fight well. Not like them bloody tieflings.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I think they like you less than they like me. It's almost impressive, how detestable you are.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Thanks, mum. Now please do feck off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Thick with sarcasm

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Charming. I can see why the locals like you so much.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Them devils ain't local - they're refugees. Fella who runs this place offered 'em shelter.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: And whose home is this exactly?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Druids. And they ain't the friendly type. The only one of 'em worth a damn was the leader, and he ain't here anymore.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What makes you say they're not friendly?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: They like trees more than they like people.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What happened to their leader?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Aye. His name's Halsin, and if he's still alive, he'll be cursing the day he laid eyes on me.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: We've got a contract to track down some relic, and he wanted in on the job. Eyes lit up when he heard about it.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Didn't work out, though. Goblins got him when we were turning tail. He's either diggin' latrines or boilin' in a cookpot by now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You ran away from a few goblins?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Wasn't no few goblins, mate. There's an entire hive of 'em. Contract failed to mention that part.

session_synopses: Adventurer leader dialogue. Mostly used during Adventurers Quest. This is after the player has stopped Zevlor and Aradin from fighting one another. Aradin returns to his den to lick his wounds.

VB_ReturnedToGrove.speaker: Player
VB_ReturnedToGrove.text: I was a slave when we were last here. I do not appreciate being reminded of that.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: You came! I have - here! Mol said I should thank you properly. For the harpies.
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: The kid takes something out of his back pocket. If you can suggest that he's holding a pageoff-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: So I wrote you a story!
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: If you can suggest that he's offering the player a page off-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Player
InHideout.text: Aren't you the clever one? That's very kind.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: Ah - ummm, it's gone. I had it just now, I'm - I'm sorry.

VB_PlayerWarnings.speaker: Player
VB_PlayerWarnings.context: NodeContext: wondering, a little bit in awe.

AD_HarpyAttackedEarly.speaker: Harpy
AD_HarpyAttackedEarly.context: NodeContext: Feral bird-woman - a scream of rage and hunger

AD_HarpyInterrupted.speaker: Harpy
AD_HarpyInterrupted.context: NodeContext: Feral bird-woman - rage and hunger

VB_FoundHarpyNest.speaker: Player
VB_FoundHarpyNest.text: A giant nest... let's see what we can find.
VB_FoundHarpyNest.context: NodeContext: They enter the nest and smell the offal the harpies left behind.

session_synopses.InHideout: You encounter the kid you saved from the harpies in the children's hideout. He wants to thank you, but is still a little shy.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerCharmed: AD when the player is charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.VB_PlayerWarnings: AD played when the player gets close to the harpy situation, warning them that something is amiss.
session_synopses.AD_HarpyAttackedEarly: AD when player attacks the Harpy leader before the proper combat starts
session_synopses.AD_HarpyInterrupted: AD that fires when the player wakes up the halfling (the harpy's prey) from his enchantment.
session_synopses.VB_FoundHarpyNest: VB when the player finds the Harpy's nest
session_synopses.AD_GnomeUncharmed: The tiefling kid wakes up fron his trance, he's panicked and (almost) crying because he's so frightened.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: Forget it, rat. You can explain it yourself.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You'd decline the honour? Very well.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Halsin's always welcomed untouchables to your midst. Defiled the grove for the sake of 'harmony'.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: We've come from Cloakwood to correct his mistakes.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Cloakwood... Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: That snake must be held accountable.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: By every star, by every vein on every leaf, she must.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: This has only happened because our true leader was taken from us.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: Kagha seems happy to rule the roost. Who's your real leader?

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Master Halsin. Perhaps goblin-caught, perhaps dead. He'd set... Mistress Kagha back in line. Hold her to task. Stop this damned ritual.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: More will die if the rite is finished. So many more, sent into a world gone mad...

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: I'm in need of a healer. Badly.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Like many, you seek Halsin's craft. But you'll have to settle for Nettie.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Find her further in the cave. Her gift is great, too - you can trust her.
Opposed.context: InternalNodeContext: show this only if the player didn't already find Halsin, no need to be redundant if the player already knows

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: A deep elf - in our grove, on this day. A sign. Or rather, a gift.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: Who better to understand a watchful broodmother than a beloved child of Lolth?

Leader.speaker: Player
Leader.text: I'd have killed the thief outright.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: Yes. Yes. This could be the true way of Silvanus.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: The viper bares her fangs defending her brood. It is only right that she strike the killing blow.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: The others might consider this sacrilege. But we know the truth: it is necessity.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: I took back the Idol of Silvanus and the rite has resumed. We will seal the grove. Free from harm. Free of intruders.

PAD_KidDied.speaker: Player
PAD_KidDied.text: The snake killed that girl in front of everyone. Is this grove worth a dead child?

PAD_KidDied.speaker: Player
PAD_KidDied.text: The longer we stay here, the closer we come to reaching the same fate.
PAD_KidDied.context: NodeContext: Karlach just watched some druids accidentally kill a tiefling girl. She's stunned.

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Rath
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She's dead. Kagha, we are guardians, not killers!

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Kagha
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She knew the danger. She still tried to run.

AD_LeaderPersuaded.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded.text: How could I be so weak?

AD_LeaderPersuaded.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded.text: Dearest Rath. You deserved so much better.

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *You consider the Rite of Thorns. A rare art, plucked from illicit domains.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Player
SelfReflection.text: Think back to your teachings. What are the rite's perils?

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *When the prayer ends, vines curl upwards from the earth and thorns sprout forth.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *Those within are isolated and those without, rejected. Isolation breeds violence. Few circles survive it.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *There is more to Kagha's tale. The grove must hide her secrets.*

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.Opposed: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.Leader: Player speaks with Kagha, the secret Shadow druid. Various paths of conversation reflect whether Kagha's actions led to a child's death or not. She may be neutral/Machiavellian or pure evil, depending.
session_synopses.PAD_KidDied: Reaction after Arabella, a tiefling child, is killed by the druid Kagha's serpent in the grove. Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who was in the dialog and had opportunity to stop it. (May have tried and failed or simply refrained from acting)Speaker 2 is an accompanying character, they may have an opinionated line regarding the outcome according to their own beliefs.
session_synopses.AD_ReactToDeadKid: Rath reacts to the tiefling girl being killed by Sagha's snake. Sagha responds coldly.
session_synopses.AD_LeaderPersuaded: Plays ONLY if Rath died in the combat against the Shadow Druids! If Rath is alive, He and Kagha have an AD together instead. In all cases, Kagha is mourning, shocked and repentant at what she has done.
session_synopses.SelfReflection: Following Kagha's dialogue, if druid player asked about the rite and has not already discovered the shadow druid connection, they experience a self-reflection. There is more to this tale; you should search Kagha's quarters. Journal entry to search her quarters appears.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Hello, petal! Need anything? Any lotions or potions?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Cheerful and sincere. This is her second time meeting the player. Acting like they're friends already.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I need help. I've been infected by a mind flayer parasite.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you recount your adventure, Auntie Ethel nods along - her eyes wide.*
You poor pet. My heart goes out to you, truly.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She clutches her chest, looking incredibly concerned and sympathetic. NodeContext: Deep concern and sounds sincere. Very worried about the player.

node_data.text: I see no sign of a tentacle yet, but that could change in an instant. You need help, serious help.
I've ne'er a potion or lotion here that could do it, but...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking around, concerned as she tries to think of something. Shaking her head.

node_data.text: ...yes. I may have something at home!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes light up. Smiles. NodeContext: Hope and cheer in her voice. She sounds like she genuinely wants to help.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I doubt a simple potion will suffice. This problem calls for strong magic.
Petal, the things I've collected would blow your pretty little mind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Getting into 'salesman' mode, is trying to entice the player to come to her home.

node_data.text: Bracelets that hold the power of ten men, mirrors that capture the soul...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Ibid.

node_data.text: I'll be heading home soon. Here. Let me mark it on your map - just in case.
node_data.context: NodeContext: almost winking at just in case. Expects player to show up at her home, confident that she's baited them enough.

node_data.text: Oh, and those potions you swiped from me? Keep them - call it a gift from your Auntie Ethel.
See you around, petal.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Amused.

VB_HagLeaves.speaker: Player
VB_HagLeaves.text: That old woman was certainly memorable.
VB_HagLeaves.context: NodeContext: Positive but unsure. She was charming but also strange.

session_synopses: Auntie Ethel appears to be a charmingly roguish old lady selling potions in the grove. She is actually a hag in disguise. The player can explain what happened with the tadpole and Ethel offers to meet them at her home in order to 'help them'. The player can also get poison from her for the goblin camp, but she asks them to do her a favour instead.
session_synopses.VB_HagLeaves: VB played when the player sees the Hag leave the Den.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: Lives are at stake, and the cowards only care about their bloody rituals!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player re; the druids, who are still relatively close.

Protester2.speaker: Amek
Protester2.text: Looks like the druids have eased off some. Small mercies.
Protester2.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
ParentsScene.text: She's a thief, hellspawn. And you will wait for Kagha's judgement. Now get back.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over her - roaring in her faceNodeContext: Snapping back at the woman. The child is a thief and a liar as far as you're concerned. Right in her face as you snap at her to get back,

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Argh. Let me through, mragreshem, or I'll rip your damned throat out!
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Move as if to push past the guardsNodeContext: You've lost your temper, you're pushing past - utterly furious

ParentsScene.speaker: Maggran
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transform into a bear. Stamping the ground and roaring - the tieflings jumpe back wards.NodeContext: Roar in rage as you transform into a bear

Parents.speaker: Komira
Parents.text: Unless you have news of Arabella I don't want to hear it.
Parents.context: NodeContext: You still don't know if your daughter is okay. Tense and irritated - snapping a little though you don't mean to. You're just worried.

Parents.speaker: Player
Parents.text: Kagha will release her soon, just hold on.

Parents.speaker: Komira
Parents.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter will be released 'soon'. Snapping and frustrated. You need to see here and you're terrified for her.

Parents.speaker: Locke
Parents.text: Hang on, love. This'll be over soon enough - we just gotta wait a bit longer.
Parents.context: NodeContext: You see your wife's temper rising and you're trying to calm the situation. You know she's just worried for your daughter.

Parents.speaker: Locke
Parents.text: Thank you. Sincerely. I don't know what we'd do without our little girl.
Parents.context: NodeContext: Turning to the player - love and gratitude in your voice.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: Damn it. We could have taken those guards.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: I'd rather you not get eaten by a bear.

SoloParentB.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB.text: You bastard - you lied to me. You said Arabella was all right!
SoloParentB.context: NodeContext: Rage-filled grief. Player lied and said your daughter was alive. She was actually dead. Stepping towards player.

SoloParentB.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB.text: You have any sense? You and that snake Kagha will sleep with one eye open.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.Protester1: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.Protester2: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.ParentsScene: Marricko and Locke are trying to force their way past multiple guards to get into the inner grove. Their daughter was taken by the druids and stands accused of thievery. This is a tense scene - the threat of violence close to the surface. Their daughter is NOT present - she is in the inner chambers of the druid grove.
session_synopses.Parents: Locke and Marrick are parents who are scared for their daughter Arabella. Taken by the druids, Arabella is appearing in court on accusations of thievery. Her parents have no doubt that she is guilty but they are terrified for her and trying to get to her.Marrick hides his concern throughout with anger and threats of violence. It is easier to deal with fury then it is to temper fear. Locke is more level-headed but no less close to violence. Marrick and Locke are both at the entrance to the inner grove and the sacred pool and have just been denied entry.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsLeaving: Parents have just walked away from guards after being threatened. The situation has dissolved but they are tense - the wife in particular.
session_synopses.SoloParentB: Marricko's dialog after her kid is back (and she thanked and rewarded the player) or after learning that her kid is dead.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsSeeCorpse: This is the edgecase in which the player takes Arabella's corpse and dumps it in front of her parents. They are hysterical with grief.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Another outsider? This place has certainly become popular.
005.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arron turns around and wipes his hands on his trousers (he was standing at a table, with his back to the player).

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Well met, and thank you for beating back those goblins. Most brave of you.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Is there anything you need? Act fast if you do - the ritual will be complete before too long.

005.speaker: Player
005.text: What ritual are you talking about?

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Ah - I forgot you're a blow-in. A few days hence, this grove will be completely concealed by thorny vines.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: None will be able to enter - or leave.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: A drastic measure. But more monsters seem to terrorise this region every day.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: We druids will be safe. As for those that took refuge here... well, may Silvanus guard them as they continue their travels.

005.speaker: Player
005.text: Seems like most are tieflings. They'll be fine. They have devilish powers.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Ignorance is agony, my friend. I will include you in my prayers. I'd better get started - for your sake.

session_synopses.005: Arron is a friendly, but tired servant to the druids in the grove. Unless the player is a druid, he would rather they don't linger, though he is sympathetic and will help them any way he can (by selling them supplies). He is happy to see a druid and to help them. He can be a little preachy.

PAD_TunnelTurret.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelTurret.text: Glowing eyes are rarely a good sign. Best be careful.

session_synopses.PAD_TunnelTurret: Played when discovering one of the druid turret totems.

session_synopses.AD: AD of very lazy bear in the water.

AD_Training.speaker: Wyll
AD_Training.text: Good work, kids. You're all heroes, each and every one of you.

AD_Trainee1Responses.speaker: Wyll
AD_Trainee1Responses.text: Grind your feet into the ground. Really lock 'em in.

AD_Trainee1Responses.speaker: Wyll
AD_Trainee1Responses.text: Now hold the left arm across your face - and jab with the right.
AD_Trainee1Responses.context: CinematicNodeContext: Umi swings her practice blade.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Wyll
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Patiently, warning them to stop arguing.

session_synopses.AD_Training: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee1Responses: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Stop it! You're not going to find the antidote.

Apprentice.speaker: Player
Apprentice.text: Then help me. Give me a chance to beat this.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: I can't. I can't let you endanger this camp.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Please, just sit down. Make your prayers. Let things take their course.

session_synopses.Apprentice: The player is locked in Nettie's lab and has done something to annoy her (ie. Stolen, damaged, or moved something she owned, or been caught trying to pick her pocket.) Nettie has poisoned the player, and is wary of you finding the antidote while looking around.

AD.speaker: Guex
AD.context: NodeContext: Concentrating, exerting himself - then flubbing it.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Step, parry, strike - damn it! It's just not... agh!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trying and failing at swordplay practiceNodeContext: Frustrated. Practicing swordplay with little success - then reacts with alarm upon seeing a gith

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Sorry, sorry. I've just never seen... your face is... well. I should get back to it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Apologising, A little unnerved by a gith

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Interesting technique. Having some trouble?

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Nothing but. Goblins in the wilds, out for blood. And the druids in here, looking to kick us out - or worse.
node_data.context: NodeContext: unloading his burdens

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: We need to be ready for a fight - but I'm useless with a sword.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'I'm doing my best, but my best isn't good enough'

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Demonstrate a swing - show him the fluidity of movement he lacks.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player mimics a sword swing.

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Like this, you mean? Step-step, strike! Yes!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing.NodeContext: Successful attempt

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: I'll try and brace them better - like so. Step-brace, parry, swing! Yes!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing.NodeContext: Successful attempt

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Good advice - If I had two copper, I'd owe you one.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful (but he has nothing to give the player)

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: You really know what you're doing! Found this by the road - bet you'll put it to good use.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses.AD: Guex, a tiefling refugee, practices his swordplay on a wooden dummy. If he received pointers from the player, his efforts are improved. Otherwise, he stuggles.
session_synopses: Tiefling is practicing his swing on  a dummy, trying to improve. The player can offer advice, potentially improving the tiefling's form.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Did that...? No, damn it. Still nothing.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Maybe - maybe it just needs time to wear off. Fingers crossed the goblins don't return any time soon.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: You. Saw you fighting those slimy bastards.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowl in hand, paused mid preperation of gruel. Next to a pot with a ladle in hand. Looking at the player, appears annoyed. NodeContext: Gruff sounding. Shouldn't be clear if you're annoyed at the player or not.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds the bowl out to the player. Nods towards it, doesn't expect to be refused. NodeContext: Gruff as you hand the food to the player. Doesn't expect the player to refuse.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Best to fill your belly now - while we still can.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding the bowl out. NodeContext: Warmth to her voice despite the gruff exterior. She's obviously concerned about the player but is hiding it.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
