RefugeeChef.text: Suit yourself, but the only way we'll make it to Baldur's Gate is to run, and run hard.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards her. NodeContext: Player has turned down your food. You're annoyed but hiding it with indifference.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: If a gnoll catches your scent, you'll need every bit of strength. Trust me.

AD_TieflingGuard1.speaker: Rikka
AD_TieflingGuard1.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's staring at the dead below.NodeContext: Shocked and scared.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sluggishly gets up. (It moves in scripting, after the dialogue has ended.)

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper.text: You could hold off a horde of goblins from this position.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Maybe - but we're not fighters. If they broke through, it'd be a massacre.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: slightly reassured but still anxious

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: The sooner we leave for Baldur's Gate, the better.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Aradin's back with his tail between his legs. I'm glad for your help, but I'd hoped you were Halsin.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Hells, I didn't mean it that way. Halsin's important, but you're the first bit of good faith we've had since he left.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Keep your wits about you. Things are tense with the druids here.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: O Selûne, Our Lady of Silver.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying for her dead friend. The goddess she addresses is Selune (seh-LOON-eh)

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: Please, may he rest by Your side.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying over the body of her dead friend

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He always knew what to say... when I was homesick.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He never let it show, but he was homesick, too.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.text: *Here lies Zevlor. He saved us when all hope seemed lost. Thank you, friend.*
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

AD_TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_TieflingGuard10.text: Goblins, gnolls... so many ways to die.
AD_TieflingGuard10.context: NodeContext: Morbid jokes about how to die - jovial.

PAD_ShadowheartBook.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBook.text: A temple of Shar? Where? And what's this about a curse?
PAD_ShadowheartBook.context: NodeContext: First she's heard of this temple.

PAD_BearStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_BearStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Forest Father, we are granted balance.*

Squirrel.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel.text: *The squirrel lunges at your foot and bites it.*

Squirrel.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel.text: *You follow the squirrel's gaze to a pair of clumsy, ugly feet. Your own, on her territory.*

Squirrel.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel.text: *Looking around, 'her territory' extends from one end of the grove to another.*

Squirrel.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel.text: *The squirrel chitters scornfully as your foot whistles over her head.*
Squirrel.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kicks and misses the squirrel

Squirrel.text: CinematicNodeContext: |Player fatally kicks the squirrel in the head. She collapses.|
Squirrel.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Player fatally kicks the squirrel in the head. She collapses.|

Squirrel.speaker: Astarion
Squirrel.text: Oh, it's everywhere. You ruined a perfectly good snack.
Squirrel.context: NodeContext: Is annoyed that you stamped a squirrel to death when he could've eaten it

Squirrel.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel.text: *You claim victory over the squirrel, though you're not sure why you were fighting to begin with.*

PAD_EntranceStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_EntranceStatue.text: *This grove is kept by Silvanus' faithful.*

GruntingKid_Hideout.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_Hideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: with a nod of greetingNodeContext: abrupt greeting

Refugee4.speaker: Toron
Refugee4.text: We should get moving. Goblins are bound to regroup eventually.
Refugee4.context: NodeContext: Glimmer of hope. Eager to get moving.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.context: NodeContext: Putting on a good front, but slightly afraid. Should still sound confident though.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: My friend's blood not enough? Come to rip me open too?
TieflingGuard11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tiefling raises his weapon half-heartedly.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard11.text: You've seen other githyanki? Tell me where - or I'll have your head.
TieflingGuard11.context: InternalNodeContext: Prior to gith chokepoint, otherwise this info is useless to the player so failing this option might have them reload for nothing

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: Stand back, toad. I owe you nothing!

AD_Adventurer02.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02.text: Damn this. Damn them. Damn everything.

VB_Grave_Kanon.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_Kanon.text: *Here lies Kanon. He gave his life defending others. He will be missed.*
VB_Grave_Kanon.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.context: NodeContext: Warning the player to get back.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.text: I chipped it on the evil thing. It was horrible.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.text: Wait - you're big. You can get rid of the evil thing!

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.text: Follow me. But be ready for anything.
Rat.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'anything' - he's warning the player it could get dicy

AD_TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TieflingGuard4.context: NodeContext: Sighing, she's walking around and noticing more problems than solutions in the grove that has become a refugee camp for her people

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: Glad you were here for those goblins. Picked one off yesterday, myself. Shot her through the throat.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's closed off, crossing one arm over the other to hug herself, uncomfortable with what she did.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: That should've killed her, but... she kept gasping. Clawing at the arrow.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking away absentmindedly, reliving the bad memories.

Tiefling001.speaker: Player
Tiefling001.text: Your first kill? Don't worry - it gets easier.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: That's what Zevlor said, too. I hope you're right.
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: She's trying to be hopeful, but still has doubts.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: I want to help - I just didn't think it would feel like this.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Used to think the goblins'd kill us the second we set foot outside. But after hearing what you did at the gate...

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: ... well, I still think they'll kill us. But at least we can put up a fight.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Try not to keel over with the first blade drawn.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Well, we came through Avernus. We might not look it, but we're tough.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Who knows, some of us might even make it to Baldur's Gate.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: With trained worgs on your scent? Not likely.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: You are just a ray of sunshine, aren't you?

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Thanks for your helpful feedback, but I think we're done here.

PAD_WolfStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_WolfStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Treefather, our turmoil is calmed.*

AD_TieflingGuard3.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3.text: What I'd do for some salt...
AD_TieflingGuard3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over cooking pot - cooking. NodeContext: Slightly gruff. Talking to herself.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Another one. What are you under there, then? Ant? Aurochs?

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: The keepers of this place. They change their form to fit their need.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: They become birds, to hunt on the wing. Bears, to tear flesh with teeth. But for me - only oxen. Only same old hay.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: And I cannot even eat it, because the horned ones hide their shiny bits inside.

PAD_ElkStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_ElkStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Old Oak, all death begets life.*

Refugee1.speaker: Eramas
Refugee1.text: Goblins. Druids. This grove is a death trap.

Refugee1.speaker: Eramas
Refugee1.text: Grab what you can and get out, that's my advice.

AD_Refugee4.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee4.text: Can't keep the goblins out forever. This is no fortress, and we're no warriors.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: We've known enough grief this tenday, traveller.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: Don't be the cause of more.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *Freshly turned soil shifts beneath your feet as you approach the grave.*
GraveDig.context: NodeContext: The player has approached the grave of the very recently deceased.

GraveDig.speaker: Player
GraveDig.text: Bow your head and silently pay your respects.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *You close your eyes, finding a moment of peace.*
GraveDig.context: NodeContext: The player is paying their respects at a grave. Should be quiet and filled with reverence.

session_synopses.TieflingGuard5: She drank a potion given to her by the hag, with the promise that it would make her strong as steel. It did, but it has paralysed her legs. The effects are temporary, but she's angry and embarassed at the situation she's found herself. She doesn't suspect any foul play on the hag's part. We get a clue about this mysterious old woman selling potions in the cave, and through tagged gameplay can reveal that she's been duped. She is frustrated at herself - she wanted to help in the goblin fight, and instead she is sprawled on the ground.
session_synopses.RefugeeChef: An older woman, responsible for feeding an entire camp of refugees before they leave. She is gruff but has a heart of gold. She offers the player some gruel. Purpose is to highlight how desperate their situation is.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard1: AD for a shelshocked tiefling patrolling the bridge and looking at the dead below. Older tiefling.
session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorUnusable: VB when the player clicks on the elevator, but it's blocked by the bear lying on top of it.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: A bear is sleeping on the elevator, blocking it off from use. She's very tired and doesn't want to get up
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Tiefling in charge of operating the gate at the druid's grove. She saw goblins attack and saw the player(s) help to repel them. She's nervous that more attacks will be coming and that the grove's defenses won't hold, which makes her eager to get on the road to Baldur's Gate as soon as possible.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard4: Non-critpath. A tiefling who sees the confrontation with a human adventurer at the grove as part of a systemic prejudice against tieflings. He carelessly led goblins to a grove full of tiefling children, and she doesn't think he'd have done that if there were humans there.
session_synopses.AD_CorpseMove: Two tieflings standing over the body of their killed comrade, about to bury him. Rikka is frustrated and angry in her grief, Kaldani tries to be the voice of reason.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_TieflingLeader: This is the grave of Zevlor, the tiefling leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBook: Shadowheart reads a book in the druid grove that suggests theres' a temple dedicated to her patron goddess somewhere in the region.
session_synopses.PAD_BearStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.Squirrel: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the squirrel communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the squirrel speaks like a human. She shouldn't sound like a disney animal. She's serious about getting the player to leave - she sees them as a threat - but she's also cocky about it. She doesn't think she'll have any problem beating the player the player to a pulp.Players encounter the squirrel in the druid grove. For all he knows, they're encroaching on HER territory, and she wants them out. Players have several options to deal with him in SwA - persuading or intimidating her. In both versions, they can kick her to death, if they choose.
session_synopses.PAD_EntranceStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.GruntingKid_Hideout: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts in the thiefling hiedout.
session_synopses.Refugee4: A refugee, anxious about the goblins beyond the gates and the druids within.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard11: Tiefling is afraid of githyanki - he's seen one gut his friend while they were scouting.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer02: A gruff adventurer complains about being stuck in a grove full of refugees. Wants to get back to the city. Speaking to himself. Grumbling.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_Kanon: This is the grave of Kanon, the tiefling who died at the gate of the grove. He was killed by goblins. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.AD_Gatekeeper: A tiefling refugee stands watch on a battlement, unnerved and unsettled. Also has a line for her relief when the danger is gone - 'we can finallly leave'.
session_synopses.Rat: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the rat communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the rat speaks like a human. He can have some rat-like tendencies in hs delivery, but he shouldn't have a squeaky voice or come across comical.Players encounter the rat in the druid grove. He's in pain, with a chipped tooth. He chipped it on an item in a nearby chest. If players are nice to him, he'll lead them to the chest. If players remove the item, the rat excitedly jumps into the chest.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard4: Thie tiefling refugee is trying to keep an optimistic view of things, but as she walks around the grove that they're using as a shelter, she sees too many problems and not enough solutions
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This tiefling recently killed a goblin and is trying to progress the grueling death she caused. She's trying to be strong, but is deeply traumatized. Depending on the player's answer, she'll express her frustration at not being able to deal with it,be shocked, or sink deeper into depression.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard10: A Tiefling in the druid grove who's keen to banter and joke. She's a bit flirtatious, though there's an undercurrent of fear throughout it all. She's genuinely afraid that she's going to die, and her only coping mechanism is to joke about it - in this case offering to make a bet. She's looking for something to look forward to.RERECORD NOTES: All lines in that dialogue have been set to rerecord with a few line changes. Overall direction. she needs to a more tongue in cheek humorous delivery.
session_synopses.PAD_WolfStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard3: Okta is leaning over her cooking pot, trying to make something edible as she mutters to herself.
session_synopses.Mule1: The ox is waiting in the cave while the tieflings decide whether to return to the road or not. He has been watching the druids in the grove below, and how they can change into any form they wish. He's wistful and sulky, wishing he could change his own shape from an ox to something less subservient.He can give us a hint about an item stashed in his hay.
session_synopses.AD_GruntingKid: General, casual grunt from grunting kid while he's under normal circumstances in the druid grove.
session_synopses.PAD_ElkStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee4: Waiting for an attack of goblins on the druid grove. On edge.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard8: A stoic guard. You're a stranger in his camp, and he warns you no to cause trouble. They've already lost a lot of people.
session_synopses.GraveDig: This occurs in the DEN. The dead can be Kanon, Aradin or Zevlor. It is a recently made grave.

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Narrator
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: *The druids will not stand by while you abscond with their idol. Your next move will decide your fate.*

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Player
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: Apologise. You were mistaken to touch their holy relic.
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.context: InternalNodeContext: No evidence was found. Can happen if everything that was stolen was stackable, e.g. gold, and was merged with existing stacks in the player's inventory

session_synopses.GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft: This dialog triggers when you attempt to move or steal the idol.

session_synopses.DEN_PleaAtTheGate_Adventurers: World behaviours for Aradin and the group, they are banging at the gate

VB_FishOutofWater.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater.text: These tieflings prove fragile. I've a mind to end their misery myself.

VB_FishOutofWater.speaker: Player
VB_FishOutofWater.text: Calm yourself. They're survivors, not soldiers.

VB_FishOutofWater.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater.text: I fail to see the distinction.

session_synopses.VB_FishOutofWater: Lae'zel remarks on the tieflgins' frailty, and the party responds.

AD.speaker: Shadowheart
AD.text: Ugh, no matter. As long as I keep the damn thing safe.
AD.context: NodeContext: Talking to herself, trying to figure out a mysterious artefact.

session_synopses.AD: Shadowheart tries to figure out the mysterious cube that she carries with her while resting in the Druid Grove (the cube is a powerful relic that she was to retrieve deliver to her superiors - she does not know its exact nature, but has to protect it at all costs).

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.context: InternalNodeContext: Remember he could have been KO by Aradin. The flag PostConfrontationDone will make him move after the dialogNodeContext: mrag-RESH-em. Means 'shithead' in infernal. Zevlor has just woken up after being punched in the face by Aradin. He's groggy and pissed off.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: A cheap shot - to be expected from a drow. But you helped us, so instead of killing you, I'll just ask:
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Sneering, barely keeping his temper in check

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Who in the Nine Hells do you think you are?

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: I'll survive a sore jaw. What I won't tolerate is a stranger waltzing in here and interfering in our business.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Lucky for you, you seem to have spooked that adventurer trash into leaving.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Whatever your business, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Cautionary - his people are also being forced out

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: This attack will only strengthen their resolve.

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: I won't be staying long - I just need to find a healer.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Weary, doesn't know what to do

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't even see me.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Slowly and thoughtfully - considering you, idea just occurring to him

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: I'll see what I can do.

AD_DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
AD_DenIntro.text: Halsin, why would you go anywhere with that fool.
AD_DenIntro.context: NodeContext: To himself / the air - his friend Halsin is missing because of the man he / you just knocked out.

PAD_ZevlorsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_ZevlorsMap.text: Looks like we're in Elturgard. Some distance from the city of Baldur's Gate.
PAD_ZevlorsMap.context: NodeContext: Karlach, grumbling about being so far from BG

PAD_ZevlorsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_ZevlorsMap.text: Gnolls and goblins marked on the map. Travel won't be easy.

session_synopses.DenIntro: In these dialogues, Zevlor reflects on what's happened (an attack of goblins at the gate, which the player helped with) and his mistrust of and bitterness towards the druids who are reluctantly hosting his people. He is exasperated, furious, but also eager to meet anyone who could help. He'll show a flash of anger and frustration at the start if the player struck him, but is pragmatic enough to calm himself once he realises you could be more help to him than harm.
session_synopses.AD_DenIntro: Zevlor is looking over the Grove after the Raiding Party Confrontation (or looking at Aradin if Aradin is KO)
session_synopses.PAD_ZevlorsMap: |Player clicked on Zevlor's map (a map of Elturgard that shows the road to Baldur's Gate). Zevlor will likely have drawn on it.|

AD_Guards.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards.text: Don't do this to me, Kanon.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Why'd ya open my cage? Think we're gonna be friends?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Too late for that, worgmeat. My tribe's comin'.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking satisfaction

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: They're gonna burn this pretty camp for the glory of the Absolute and 'ang ya by yer guts.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've never heard of this god of yours.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Goddess.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Emphatically

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: We're burnin' Her name across the face o' the world, we are.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: The Absolute is gold from the sky, She is. The blessin' in the storm an' the storm itself.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: With the way things are going, I could use a blessing.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: I ain't surprised. Tell you wot.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Help me escape, an' I'll tell my tribe to leave ya alone when they murder this place.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Then you can come to our camp an' learn all about the Absolute. Deal?

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Wot do ya say? We 'ave a deal?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's a deal, signed and struck.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Then hurry up an' do it. My tribe ain't as friendly as I am.

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader.text: Why don't you just set me free, tiefy?

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader.text: I'll tell you everything you want to know... I swear.
AD_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: she's messing with him. she won't tell him shit and they both know it. she's wheedling him.

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader.text: And you ain't a good player.

PAD_Healer.speaker: Player
PAD_Healer.text: A goblin healer? That's a new one. But she might be the only way to keep our skulls intact.

PAD_Healer.speaker: Player
PAD_Healer.text: She's worth talking to, at least.

Friend.speaker: Memnos
Friend.text: So much death. So much waste.
Friend.context: NodeContext: Arka is dead. Cold grief - not falling apart, but trying to keep it together.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: That goblin is in my debt - should prove useful one day.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: Or it'll come back to haunt us.
PAD_Freed.context: NodeContext: Karlach: A little naive but sincere.

session_synopses.AD_Guards: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.
session_synopses:
If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp. Note from Swen on this dialogue: ''I also want a different emotion in there. This goblin is negotiating with me. Think a terrorist that is locked up and who is offering their interrogators an option to save their lives if they free her.
It'll be quite the intense conversation.''
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeader: Conversation between Zevlor and Sazza that the player can overhear. The idea is that the player will understand there's something weird going on with Zevlor, that he isn't all he seems, without giving away the whole shebang.
session_synopses.PAD_Healer: Played after being told by Sazza about Gut.Speaker 1 is the character who left the dialog. Neutral inquisitive remark about whether the rumoured healer could really help.Speaker 2 is any other party member. Line can be opinionated.
session_synopses.Friend: Memnos - the supporting optional tiefling character in the Captive Goblin situation, Friend to Arka.
session_synopses.PAD_Freed: This VB plays after Sazza was escorted outside of the Grove.The dialog may play with one or two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who helped her escape.Speaker 2 is an accompanying party member, and as such may have an opinion on the issue.

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: These druids are insane - why are they doing this?!

ZenBear.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear.text: You ruined it! You ruined Master's grove!

Prodigy.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy.text: So you can handle yourself. Not bad - those druids really should have known better.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: We no longer need to fear a dagger in the back from our kindly hosts. Thank you - for standing by us.

AD_Refugee004.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee004.text: Bloody druids! You let us in! You gave us shelter!

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'will'. The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Tiefling004.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004.text: I'll take you all on! Just try me.

Trainee001.speaker: Umi
Trainee001.text: I just want to go home.
Trainee001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down, sadNodeContext: The druids are dealt with. He just wants to go back home and be safe again.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.text: Goblins might not even come. Right?

HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader.text: You're alive! Did you get the idol? Is that why they went crazy?
HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: surprised, pleased, slightly breathless - she has been hiding from an attack, and just realised it's over

HideoutLeader.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader.text: I don't have it. Let's just be glad we're alive.

HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: Frustrated to have lost out on a treasure

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You're a person with many faces.

Tiefling005.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005.text: I was able to wiggle a toe earlier - I guess that potion is finally wearing off. Terrible timing, as usual.

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.text: Eerie little black rock. Wonder what it does?

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.text: Probably rots your fingers off. Leave it be!

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: We managed against the druids, but half our weapons are bent or broken.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: The goblins will run us through unless I get them mended.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: How are you managing to forge anything out here?

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: When Elturel fell into Avernus, I was drafted into an infernal forge. Learned a few techniques for making a lot out of a little.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: Between you and me, there's nothing in all the realms like the utter power of infernal machinery. Can't replicate it outside the Hells. Probably for the best.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: Though I wouldn't mind a bit of hellfire to put to use protecting this place.

AD_Trainer.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer.text: Children - find a place to hide. Don't come out 'til I call.

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.text: How long will you be down here, anyway?

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Alfira
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.text: Just until it's safe to go out. Don't worry. How about a story in the meantime?
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: Smiling and relaxed - trying to be friendly

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: A little petulant sounding but you actually really wanted a story

DruidGuard001.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001.text: Time to reclaim our grove. Stand in our way and we'll cut you down.
DruidGuard001.context: NodeContext: Combative. Spoken just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

PetWolf.speaker: Silver
PetWolf.text: Master says you're good. Told me to protect you. But one wrong move, and your flesh is mine.

Protester3.speaker: Xeph
Protester3.text: Thought we were safe here. But nowhere's safe, is it?
Protester3.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Even in victory, attitude's a little defeated.

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Damn it. How many are there?
ProdigyBrother.context: NodeContext: In the middle of the fight - grim and determined.

PrisonGuard.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard.text: You look ready. Wish it were contagious.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: I'm glad we were here - who knows what would have happened otherwise?

ParentB.speaker: Komira
ParentB.text: Thanks for gutting the druid bastards. Only wish I could've taken a few myself.

ExcitedBoar.speaker: Tusk
ExcitedBoar.text: I should've known. All two-legs are the same!

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.speaker: Rikka
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.text: I do need some armour, you know.

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.speaker: Dammon
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.text: Can't outfit all of you at once.

SnakeKid.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid.context: NodeContext: whispered, barely audible, head down

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: NodeContext: Second line where she's a bit more awake. The previous line was "You *yawn* woke me up!"

Protester2.speaker: Amek
Protester2.text: I hope that lot burn in whatever hell they're destined for.
Protester2.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Still keyed-up and outraged at what's happened.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: I'm sorry. But this must be done.
RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

RangerTrader.speaker: Eramas
RangerTrader.text: Thank you for helping us. Seems like there's still a few real adventurers left.

DruidOpposed.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed.text: We've won, yes, but at what cost? The peace of this grove has been shattered forever.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: The druids have gone mad - save yourself!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Urgent - there's a bloody fight between druids and refugees unfolding in the grove

Scammer.speaker: Nerela
Scammer.context: NodeContext: She's trying to act natural.

AD_TraineesAfterAttack.speaker: Gan
AD_TraineesAfterAttack.text: Why didn't those druids like us?

AD_TraineesAfterAttack.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineesAfterAttack.text: No one likes us. Cause we're tieflings.

AD_TraineesAfterAttack.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineesAfterAttack.text: Don't say that. It's their fault, not ours.

Pickpocket.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket.text: I think we made those animal people mad.
Pickpocket.context: NodeContext: One of the other tiefling children stole an idol from the druids - she thinks they're attacking because they're mad about that. She's scared.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.text: We had the druids to worry us before. Not anymore. We can defend this place.

AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.text: This place could use a little light.
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: a little wry. she wants to cut down some trees.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: You can beat them, can't you?

AD_SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef.text: We're done running. Hold your ground!

AD_ParentA.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentA.context: NodeContext: Whispered - trying to keep everyone calm during the attack.

PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader.text: There goes half my customers. But you'll make up the difference, right?
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: The druids are all dead. She's miffed to lose her customer base, but is secretly relieved the whole thing is over.

PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader.text: Just have to replenish our stock first.
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: The druid attack is over - she's planning on looting the druids' belongings.

ServantPlight.speaker: Arron
ServantPlight.text: This is your last chance. Leave.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: Killing goblins is one thing, but this...
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: ... I think I'm going to be sick.
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

AD_DruidGuard1.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1.context: NodeContext: Moving to attack - combat imminent

Tiefling010.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010.text: You stood by us. I thought you might. Glad I was right. You might even hang around and help us deal with goblins, by my reckoning.
Tiefling010.context: NodeContext: She's very warm to you. Playful lilt to this without being too light-hearted given the subject matter.

Trainee003.speaker: Gan
Trainee003.text: Leave one for me next time! A little one.
Trainee003.context: NodeContext: Acting tough. The druids are dealt with.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Sorry, no gruel on the pot today.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Now that this druid mess is over, I'm having to store up all the rations I can.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Which... isn't much. But we'll make do.

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Stargazer.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer.text: Don't look at me! Those druids are out for blood.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.text: Think she'll be all right with the other kids?

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.text: Mol will keep an eye on her.

Griefling.speaker: Arka
Griefling.text: Backstabbing filth. Good riddance to the lot of them.
Griefling.context: NodeContext: Lingering anger, She survived an attack by the druids, who'd originally offer her and her people shelter.

ServantIntolerant.speaker: Marcoryl
ServantIntolerant.context: NodeContext: Vicious and cruel - you are eager to spill tiefling blood

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: quiet, terrified, they're hiding from an attack

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader.text: No, Zaki. It'll be over soon.

Tiefling011.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling011.text: We're stronger than we thought. And the druid fight is proof.

Trainee002.speaker: Ide
Trainee002.text: You fought them all, didn't you? Whoa.
Trainee002.context: NodeContext: Impressed. The druids are dealt with.

DruidGuard003.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003.text: You outsiders had your chance to leave. Now blood's going to be spilled.
DruidGuard003.context: NodeContext: Combative. A fight's about to break out.

AD_FleeAfter.speaker: Zorru
AD_FleeAfter.text: Vicious gith. Murderous druids. I've had enough!

AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.speaker: Amek
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.text: Couldn't be helped. Those druids left us no choice.
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: 'We did what we had to'

AD_DruidOpposed.speaker: Rath
AD_DruidOpposed.text: Silvanus forgive me for what I must do.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Better that Master Halsin doesn't see this. It'd break his heart.

ParentA.speaker: Locke
ParentA.text: Never thought the druids would attack. Thank you. We were lucky to have you.

session_synopses.GrieflingFriend: Memnos reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings. If the tieflings prevail, he reacts to this also.
session_synopses.ZenBear: This bear is still struck with grief because his master hasn't returned, but he's also incredibly angry because the player has committed a crime.
session_synopses.AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack: Eramas is looking around the adventurers' spot in the Grove for useful stuff for the incoming goblin fight.
session_synopses.Prodigy: Rolan is being Rolan here - full of pride and arrogance, even as he begrudingly admits that the player played a large part in defending them from the druids.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Elegis is the gatekeeper for the grove. She is grim but determined to keep her kin safe as the druids attack.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee004: Toron, a tiefling, reacts to the druids attacking him and the other refugees sheltering in the grove.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: Inwe has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's calm and serious - she doesn't want to fight, but she will.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeader: Zevlor is a leader who hears commotion between his followers and a rival faction. These lines trigger from when he first hears the noise, investigates, sees a confrontation brewing to when fighting actually starts.
session_synopses.Tiefling004: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee001: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Umi is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. He's frightened while they are attacking, and clearly shaken afterward.
session_synopses.AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack: Lovers go back to packing after attack on Den.
session_synopses.HideoutLeader: During and after the druid attack, Mol is frustrated and a little anxious rather than scared. If she made a deal with the player, tough and resilient when discussing it.
session_synopses.Bard: Alfira is scared but trying to hold it together during the attack. She is with the children in the hideout. She isn't a fighter but is prepared to lay down her life to protect them. She stays in the hideout with the children afterwards.After the attack, if the player has stolen or broken her instrument she is thankful but wary of the player. Otherwise she is grateful that someone has finally stuck by the tieflings.
session_synopses.Tiefling005: Pandirna is guard who is either 1) sprawled on the ground, unable to move. 2) healed due to the player's help. If she's healed, she is ready for a fight and eager to prove herself and protect those she loved. If she paralyzed, she just wants the player to protect the other tieflings - she's convinced she'll die. If she survives, she thanks the player - knowing it is directly because of them that she survived.
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack: Okta is preparing meals for the road and Ikaron is snooping around the hag's corner, against his mother's pleas.
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: Kerrick has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.Weaponsmith_PostEA: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Dammon fights against the druids. He's provided the tieflings with their weapons, and he hopes they're up to the task. Afterward, he's back at his forge, repairing the weapons that were damaged in the skirmish.
session_synopses.AD_Trainer: Asharak is training kids when he hears commotion breaking out - he investigates to find the druid faction are attacking his people.
session_synopses.AD_YoungLover01: Danis reacts to the tiefling refugees (himself included) being attacked by the druids.
session_synopses.AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack: Tone: People trying to act somewhast normal under grave circumstances. Intreactions are intoned with gravity.The Bard is inside the kid hideout with the rest of the kids, supposedly keeping an eye on them as they are not to go outside the hideout anymore with the incoming goblin attack. Zaki is trying to act older and not scared and Alfira is playing along with it.
session_synopses.DruidGuard001: Jeorna, speaking just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.
session_synopses.Kid004: Kid responses related to druid attack.
session_synopses.RitualDruid5: Tahani has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's anxious to fight - she sees the tieflings as foreign invaders that need to be driven out.
session_synopses.PetWolf: This wolf is about to attack the other druids. He's full of energy and anticipation.
session_synopses.Protester3: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning hostile against all the tieflings (both during and after battle).
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal is fighting the people who once hosted them in the grove. He'll do it to protect the tieflings but he hates it - he would much prefer a peaceful resolution.
session_synopses.AD_DruidLeader: Kagha shouts her ADs during the attack phase.
session_synopses.PrisonGuard: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: Lia will defend her fellow tieflings to the death. She does not shy away from violence and is prepared to fight ever druid in the grove if it means saving her people.
session_synopses.ParentB: Marrick is hidden alongside the other tieflings during the attack but is unafraid. She is no fighter but if the druids reach her she will fight to her last breath. In her post attack dialogues, if her daughter has died her anger is waning even as she strives to hold onto it - the grief settling in as she realises all the dead druids in the world won't bring her daughter back.If her daughter in the post attack she is full of righteous anger - let anyone in the world take on the tieflings. They won't back down from anything.
session_synopses.ExcitedBoar: This boar was friendly to the player before. Now the player has committed a crime, and the boar feels betrayed. He's about to attack.
session_synopses.AD_ServantPlight: A battle is breaking out between the tieflings and the druids. This druid has previously tried to help the tieflings, and he is more surprised and sad than angry. He prays to his god that what they are doing is right.
session_synopses.AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack: Dammon is working to supply weapons and armour for the raid while Lakrissa and Rikka bother him during his work.
session_synopses.SnakeKid: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: This bear is about to attack, but she just woke up, and she's still sleepy.
session_synopses.AD_IrritatedTieflingTrainingAfterAttack: Guex is training on his own for the incoming goblin attack. Swinging his sword.
session_synopses.Protester2: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning on him and his companions (both during and post-combat)
session_synopses.RitualDruid4: Elwyn has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She regrets that this has to happen, but will do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.RangerTrader: This dialogue has two states: getting ready for battle and after the battle.
session_synopses.IrritatedTiefling: Guex reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings in the grove, and  if the tieflings defeat their attackers.
session_synopses.DruidOpposed: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Protester1: A tiefling refugee reacts to the conflict with the druids (during and after)
session_synopses.Scammer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_TraineesAfterAttack: Trainees are bickering over who would be better to deal with the druids and the bears, after the attack has resolved and the player has taken down the druids.
session_synopses.Pickpocket: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Silfy is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's terrified and thinks a theft may have triggered the attack. Afterward, she's back to her shy self.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack: Asharak and Zevlor are at the entrance and walking around together as they envision what sort of defense they can mount on the walls.
session_synopses.AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack: Kaldani wants to cut down some trees after the druid attack
session_synopses.RobberKid: Child pickpocket reacts ot the druid attack, and player's success in that attack.
session_synopses.AD_Tiefling001: ADs when the character is fighting a bunch of druids - she's angry, scared and full of adrenaline.
session_synopses.AD_SonOfChef: These lines play when the druids launch an attack against the tieflings in the druid grove. Ikaron's been on edge for a while, afraid something like this would happen. He doesn't hesitate to fight back - he's had enough of his people getting pushed around.
session_synopses.AD_ParentA: The druid attack has begun. Lock yells for everyone to hide and then quietly reassures the other tieflings around him to keep quiet and stay calm. He is a voice of reason and assurance.
session_synopses.PickpocketTrader: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Lim is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's fairly calm, given the situation - she's used to getting out of binds. Afterward, she's already plotting how she might get out ahead, though she's a bit irked at the player for getting rid of a source of income.
session_synopses.ServantPlight: The player committed a crime, and this druid is extremely disappointed, but doesn't want to attack, so implores the player to leave. He knows a fight will break out in mere minutes.
session_synopses.VoloBear: The bear is about to attack us, because we comitted a crime. Imagine him very angry, his hackles raised and growling.
session_synopses.AD_FoodTrader: Okta is hidden with the other tieflings. She is determined to sacrifice herself to save the others if needs be. The druid attack is on going.
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This dialogue has two states: one where the character is getting attacked and is panicked, and one for after the attack, where she is trying to calm down, but killing other people is making her feel sick.
session_synopses.AD_DruidGuard1: Jeorna, a druid, shouts orders and battle cries after she and her fellow druids turn on the tielfings. Fanatical and aggressive.
session_synopses.YoungLover02: Bex reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings.
session_synopses.Wyll: Wyll's dialogue before and after Druid attack state. This is secondary recruitment state, if you trigger druid attack before he is recruited.
session_synopses.DruidGuard002: Maggran (the bear-druid guard, now in human form again) shouts aggresively before he and the other druids turn hostile on the players and the tiefling refugees.
session_synopses.AD_Tiefling011: Zorru calls out his reactions in ADs during different states of the druid attack.
session_synopses.GruntingKid: Tiefling kid who communicates by grunting during and after druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling010: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee003: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Gan is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's full of bravado - she's had training with a wooden sword, and she's eager to show off. She doesn't quite grasp the seriousness of the situation.
session_synopses.Chef: This dialogues occurs after the druid attack. Okta is relieved that they survived and drained from being tierrified (not that she would admit it). She's trying to be tough and no nonsense about the entire event.
session_synopses.ServantGnome: Loic has lost all his patience in this dialogue - you commited a crime, and he's really angry and disgusted. This happens right before he starts to attack the player.
session_synopses.RitualDruid1: Aelar has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.Stargazer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsAfterAttack: Parents are mourning the death of their child after the druid attack. They hang around the grove and wonder what will follow.
session_synopses.Griefling: Arka reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings in the grove.
session_synopses.ServantIntolerant: Marcoryl is only too delighted to fight the tieflings. This is during the druid attack and he is eager to put down these 'hellspawn.'
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeader: Two scared young tieflings: Mol protects Zavi during the druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling011: Zorru one-liner reacting to druid attack state. Zorru has a proven dislike of githyanki, so those reactions are a bit different.
session_synopses.Trainee002: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Ide is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's frightened while they are attacking, but shakes it off quickly afterward. She's just impressed that the player could take on so many druids.
session_synopses.DruidGuard003: Spoken just before the Druids turn hostile against the tiefling refugees.
session_synopses.AD_FleeAfter: AD when Zorru flees attack on grove. He's fearful and running for his life.
session_synopses.AD_ProtestersAfterAttack: Three tieflings (who had previously been protesting their treatment at the hands of their druid hosts) react to the aftermath of a bloody confrontation between tiefling refugees and druids. In this instance the druids have all been killed. The refugees are shaken and angry.
session_synopses.CharmedKid: Two states: one where the child is about to get attacked by the druids and is panicking, and one where the player has saved him and he's grateful.
session_synopses.AD_DruidOpposed: Rath is defending the tieflings as Sagha and the other druids attempt to drive them out.
session_synopses.Apprentice: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile.
session_synopses.BirdSender: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile.
session_synopses.ParentA: Locke is hidden alongside multiple other tieflings as the druids attack the grove. In his post attack lines he is grim and depressed if his daughter is dead (even as he thanks the player.) If his daughter is alive, he is saddened that violence occured but thankful the player was there to help.

FrescoWorking.speaker: Narrator
FrescoWorking.text:
*'The forest rose with claw and tooth
to tear the darkness from its roots.'*

FrescoWorking.speaker: Narrator
FrescoWorking.text: *The mural depicts druid and beast fighting together to drive monsters from their land.*

FrescoWorking.speaker: Narrator

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator

*'The towers seized, the battle done,

session_synopses.VB_EmptyHolder: Player finds a slot in the wall where you can fit a slab of stone. This is where we'll place a stone rune, if we find one.

session_synopses.FrescoWorking: Player is viewing a mural depicting druids and animals driving monsters from the forest.
session_synopses.FrescoVictory: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting a group of druids standing over a vanquished army. Pass a test to realise that the army was the army of Shar - a Dark Goddess.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Ah, my good friend!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's holding a book and a quill, scribbling notations when he notices you.NodeContext: He's holding a book and a quill, scribbling notations when he notices you. He's happy to see you, he has questions for you!

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Forgive my surprise. It's rare to find your kind above ground. Rare and intriguing on a day already packed with intrigue!
node_data.context: NodeContext: polite and enthusiastic

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: You were at the gates just now, no? When the goblins came? You saw them up close?
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's about to start quizzing you on what you saw. Eager.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: A few questions, if you please. There's no overstating my interest.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He wants to write down what you'll say. Enthusiastic.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Fine - ask your questions.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Glory! Now, then:
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's ready to write, quill to book.NodeContext: Player agreed to answer his questions. He's happy but also arrogant, like a rich old person saying 'you're an absolute DOLL' when you do a minor favor for them.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: How would you describe that particular batch of goblins? Size? Nature? Distinguishing qualities?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Quizzing the player, looking for info for his book. He's more professional here, curious.

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You search your mind, successfully recalling various details of goblin behaviour.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Common variety goblins, led by a lasher and flanked by booyahgs.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: My! A scholar after my own heart. Spent much time among goblins?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The time was spent among books. I'm a student of the page.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Aha! I've always preferred experience to the second-hand accounts of lesser men. But to each their own!

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Now I've a few more questions, if you don't mind.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: And the... dragon they had marching in the rear. Was it of the brass or silver variety?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Volo is bullshitting. There was no dragon and he knows it. But he's stating it to the player as though he believes it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Heh - it was brass. No doubt about it.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: 'Witness... mistook... obvious... silver... dragon... for... brass...'
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in notebookNodeContext: Response to 'I said it was a brass dragon.' Volo is bullshitting.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Last question, then you'll be quite free. Did the attackers rally to 'the Absolute' when they fell upon the gates?
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's wrapping things up, in full journalism mode.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I don't think so. I was concentrating on not dying.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Really? Well, this does complicate things... but then again... well, never mind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player says goblins didn't invoke 'the Absolute.' Volo is turning the idea around in his head, trying to figure it out. A man in thought.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: I've interrogated one - a captive in this very camp. She reports they've abandoned their god Maglubiyet in favour of someone called 'the Absolute'.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: The scandal!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hissed like he's just conveyed a very juicy bit of gossip

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hold your tongue.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Never you mind. I'm on my way to their camp as we speak. I always knew my studies in Ghukliak would come to some use.

session_synopses: Volo is a canonical character in DnD. He's known for being the realm's go-to guy for compiling information. In this take, he fulfils that role but puts a twist on what he sees. He's keenly curious for facts but likes to embellish them. A bit like Gilderoy Lockheart. He IS talented, but his reputation has gotten away from him, too. In this dialogue, Volo will offer to put his knowledge at your service if you confide you've been infected with a mindflayer. He'll perform an icepick lobotomy that'll leave you without an eye or much in the way of apology from Volo. He should be clever, a little arrogant, very English, and very fun, without being a cartoon character.

AD_LookingForInstrument.text: No, no, no. It was right here.
AD_LookingForInstrument.context: NodeContext: Frantic and panicked as you search for your instrument.

AD_InstrumentStolen.text: Get away from me. I mean it!

AD_Dejected.speaker: Alfira
AD_Dejected.context: NodeContext: She has 'lost' her instrument (player stole it). You are on the brink of tears, feeling lost and ashamed - you wanted to write a song for your teacher, and now you never will. You feel like a failure.

AD_ComposingSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong.text: When you call the last light...
AD_ComposingSong.context: NodeContext: Hesitantly singing the song, feeling out the words as you compose.

AD_ComposingSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong.context: NodeContext: Hesitant as you try to figure out the song.

AD_ComposingSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - feeling like a failure.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.context: NodeContext: Gently singing. Sad but hopeful.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Smile and pain will fade away.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Words of mine will turn to ash.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: When you call the last light down.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon. Sun. All remind me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Faith. Care. All the love I can't repay.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon reminds me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: All the love I can't repay.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Rest and know that I will pray.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon. Sun. All remind me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Faith. Care. All the love I can't repay.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: You have good timing. Never been much of a fighter, so wrestling a bugbear would have gone poorly.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: But you're not here for heroics, are you? Avernus' stench is all over your skin.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Let me guess: your devil mistress sent you to get her soul coin back. Too bad. I earned it fair and square.

node_data.speaker: Karlach
node_data.text: Oh man, a soul coin? Wouldn't mind getting my hands on that...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Very interested but maybe downplaying her interest.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That bugbear would have crushed your skull. This is the thanks I get?

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Why thank you, dread slayer of bugbears. You shall live forever in my memory.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dramatically exaggerated/sarcastic.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Now take my regards back to that pouting erinyes and leave me alone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Very flat, almost cold.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How about this? You give me the coin. Now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You hand the coin over, or I kill you. How about that?
True

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Considering you turned that bugbear into paste...

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: ...that's a good trade. Except the coin seems to have slipped through a hole in my pocket somewhere. Damn it.

session_synopses.Telescope: The player interacts with a telescope at a druid grove, looking out at the scenery and potentially spotting a dragon in the sky.
session_synopses: Nadira is a witty tiefling that survived Avernus and escaped with a soul coin, a valuable currency of the Hells. She suspects the player works for the original owner of the coin, a devilish erinyes, and will have to be persuaded in order to hand it over.

session_synopses.AD_Adventurer2AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PleaAtTheGate: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.
session_synopses.AD_WyllCharge: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.
session_synopses.Adventurer1: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.
session_synopses.AdventurerLeader: Minor dialogues before and after Aradin/ Zevlor's confrontation insider the camp.
session_synopses.Adventurer2:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinCaptain: A goblin veteran leading a raid on a druid grove - he's giving orders to his troops
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened: The tiefling leader calls for the doors to be opened with an AD if players are outside of dialog range.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate: Plea from the adventurer leader at the gates - goblins are almost here, he needs Zevlor to open up! Zevlor is being circumspect.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderRant: Rant the tiefling leader says before going off to meet the adventurers after the goblin raid.
session_synopses.VB_ApproachingGate: VB played when the players are approaching the gates of the DEN.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer1AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.AD_WyllWantsOut: AD used by Wyll when his first combat turn against the goblin raiders start. This should be cried out valiantly! Wyll has arrived to save the day!
session_synopses.PAD_ConfrontationResolved: READ IN FULL, YOU HAVE TO SCROLL DOWN:VB that plays after DEN_RaidingParty_Confrontation. The dialog ends either with peace having been achieved or with one leader being knocked out by either the opposing leader or a player.This VB has a greeting for each outcome, but there really are three main categories: Player punched a leader, the leaders punched each other OR piece was achieved.Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the player who was in the Confrontation dialog, and as such may have punched one of the leaders.Speaker 2 is an accompanying character and as such may be opinionated.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderRant: Complaint the adventurer leader says after the goblins have been dealt with, before returning to the Den after the gates are opened.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersArgue: Argument that loops over itself while the leader await the arrival of the player. They are both furious and high-energy, having just survived the goblin encounter.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingWakesUp: Player when the tiefling leader wakes up after being knocked out in the confrontation of Raiding Party.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderSpotsWyll: Plays when Avatar is Wyll in raiding party, during combat.

session_synopses.AD_ToronCurious: Toron notices you speaking with the strabge ox, but he's not too concerned, just curious.
session_synopses.AD_OxReaction: This AD plays after you have spoken with the ox with SwA, if you linger or pass by the ox again.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: We did it. Come on, give me a kiss.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: Hold still! I'll kiss you when you've stopped bleeding, you lummox.
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.context: NodeContext: Concentrating on seeing to his wounds. Gentle admonishment

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: Yes, you are. Now stop squirming!
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.context: NodeContext: 'I love you and share in your happiness but you're being pain in the arse right now'

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel.text: Would you be careful? We're going to spill if you don't stop shaking.
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Irritated, trying to pour oil into a container

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, she's afraid and he's pointed it out so she's defensive. She cuts herself off before finishing the outburst.

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: lecturing, not picking up on Pandirna's mood

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Bitten off, quietly insistent. She's close to snapping.

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: Backing off, as if she's being unreasonable but he's being the bigger person.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Look at this place. Like a pen of hogs waiting for the butcher's knife. We need to act!

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Quiet! Some of the children might hear you.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Oh, perish the thought they overhear a little honesty once in their short lives -

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Another word and it won't be the goblins you have to worry about!

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Player
ProdigyTrio.text: Let them argue. Right now, anger's more useful than despair.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Trust me, I'm feeling both anger and despair.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Why, I think I'm almost in agreement with you on that score.

AD_LookingForDoni.speaker: Rikka
AD_LookingForDoni.text: Doni! I don't want to lock you outside, please.
AD_LookingForDoni.context: NodeContext: More quietly than her other shouts, as much to herself.

AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.text: Good work - the True Souls are proper pleased.
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.context: NodeContext: calling out to other goblins after a victory

Tiefling004.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004.text: Admiring my beautiful barricades? Might not be pretty, but they'll stop a charging worg.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: You can leave your valuables with me if you like.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: Goblins strip the dead down to the last stitch, so I hear.
RobberKid.context: NodeContext: Knowingly, trying to freak player out

RobberKid.speaker: Player
RobberKid.text: No one's going to die today. I promise.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.context: NodeContext: He sighs, as if the player is being unreasonable.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.context: NodeContext: All but saying the player's going to die.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: Can you two help? Anything you don't pack is getting left behind.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Meli
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: We can always get more stuff later.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: You won't get there if we starve on the way. Gonna rob your friends when you're hungry?

ParentB.speaker: Komira
ParentB.text: I pray next time I square up to a goblin, you're there again.

RaiderMurderous.speaker: Warrior Rua
RaiderMurderous.text: Goblin kids would 'ave put up a better fight.
RaiderMurderous.context: NodeContext: malicious - describing a child who tried to fight back during an attack

RaiderMurderous.speaker: Warrior Rua
RaiderMurderous.text: Killed my first human when I was five years old. Tieflings are soft.
RaiderMurderous.context: NodeContext: malicious glee - talking about killing a tiefling child

Refugee002.speaker: Danis
Refugee002.text: I wish I could help on the walls, but... I wasn't a soldier, really. Just a trumped-up guard.

Refugee002.speaker: Danis
Refugee002.context: NodeContext: He gives up on trying to come up with an excuse - frightened and apologetic.

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: ... and over the horizon they saw a ship, like some great beast bursting from the waves.

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: The Wandering Eye, the jewel of Balduran's fleet! So named because -
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Moment of a story where hero returns

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: - well... because Balduran travelled far and... saw much.
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Catching herself, realizing children might not understand concept of Wandering Eyes

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: But he had finally come home to save the city he loved!

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: He drove the raiders away and raised a wall to protect his people.
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Happy ending, reassuring them that evil was defeated

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: And so they named the city to honour him. Balduran's - Baldur's Gate.

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Ah - there you are. No, we haven't met - but I know your work.
BackupLeader.context: NodeContext: Wry, distant - she wants to speak with you but also resents you a little (Though she knows it's unfair)

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Came back to report some lunatic had cleared out the goblin leaders - only to find Zevlor'd gone the same way.
BackupLeader.context: NodeContext: Amused at the irony, but really just covering sadness with grim pragmatism

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: He was supposed to play chaperone with this lot, not me. But - moaning won't make the road ahead shorter, I suppose.
BackupLeader.context: NodeContext: Wry, vaguely bitter - as if Zevlor shirked left her with a task she'd rather not have to do.

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's all we have.
BackupLeader.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

AD_HideoutLeaderSighing.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderSighing.text: Some dumb fairy tale is all we have left...

Sapper_004.speaker: Sapper Gald
Sapper_004.context: NodeContext: smug - just massacred some tieflings

RitualDruid005.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid005.text: I'm not singing your praises. You and the tieflings brought violence to this place.
RitualDruid005.context: NodeContext: Coolly. She blames both players and the tieflings in the grove for causing trouble.

RitualDruid005.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid005.text: It wasn't our fight. You dragged us into it.
RitualDruid005.context: NodeContext: She's accusing the player, pointing at them. She blames both players and the tieflings in the grove for causing trouble.

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: 'Lathander to light, Selûne to guide, Kelemvor to show mercy -'

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Narrator
GrieflingFriend.text: *You realise he prays to Kelemvor, Lord of Death.*

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: What is it? I'm... I'm busy.

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend.text: Mind if I join you in prayer?

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: I do mind. This isn't exactly my bravest moment; I'd rather suffer it alone.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You took it upon yourself to undertake the Rite of Thorns? To spill blood in this sacred place?
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Reading the riot act to Kagha

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: It would have been easier if you just died, Kagha. Now I have to hear your excuses instead.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: I owe you nothing. Goblins swarmed us like roaches while you stumbled after the past.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You chose to abandon us. I chose to protect us!

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: Silence. The rite has been ended.
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Forceful. He's heard enough from her.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: I will allow you to stay. But consider yourself a novice anew. You have forgotten the ways of the druids - our place in the natural order.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You shall learn it all once again, right here. Backslide, and nature's fury will crush you.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: CinematicNodeContext: She gives a reluctant bow and retreats from HalsinNodeContext: Not happy. Said through clenched teeth. She gives a reluctant bow and retreats from Halsin

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: You were too lenient. There's bad blood between tieflings and druids because of her.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader.text: Spilled blood will not right bad blood. Allow me to deal with my own - I still have need of her.
HalsinAndDruidLeader.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

Pickpocket.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket.text: Mattis says we should say thank you.
Pickpocket.context: NodeContext: Shy, not understanding that they almost died

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: Yeah. It's all... green. Why do druids store tree muck inside?

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: Dunno. But some of it's gotta be valuable, right?
AD_WarehouseLooters.context: NodeContext: Eager, hoping to make a profit

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: Maybe. Can't tell if it's for eating or smoking though.
AD_WarehouseLooters.context: NodeContext: A bit put out. Not sure if this raid is worth his time.

AD_WarehouseLooters.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarehouseLooters.text: *Ah-choo!* Ugh... smells funny whatever it's for. Grab as much as you can.

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.text: We should have raided another tavern.

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.text: We should have raided a town.
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.context: NodeContext: escalating from 'tavern' to town, half-joking

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.context: NodeContext: escalating from town to 'city' as potential target for next raid - mostly joking

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: What's taking you two so long? Get the goods and get moving!
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.context: NodeContext: Preemptively annoyed with his subordinates - they're not very smart.

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: Gurd keeps sneezing and dropping stuff.
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.context: NodeContext: Respectfully talking to his boss - and getting his friend in trouble

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: Shut your mouth! I... *Ah-choo!* Feckin' leaves.
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.context: NodeContext: Gurd is allergic to the herbs in the storehouse he looted and keeps sneezing

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndLooters.text: You serious? Stuff something in yer nose and hurry up.

Refugee003.speaker: Bex
Refugee003.text: Someone decided we were the best suited to see to any wounded.
Refugee003.context: NodeContext: Bemused, out of her depth.

Refugee003.speaker: Bex
Refugee003.text: Better all 'round if you keep everyone in one piece up there. Trust me.
Refugee003.context: NodeContext: Making a joke of it, but an edge of really urging to you protect everyone

LairDoor.speaker: Doni
LairDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera pans down to show Doni, Player and the DoorNodeContext: Worried grunt as he greets the player - trying to communicate a hopeless situation

LairDoor.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor.text: Go away! There's nothing in here for you - for any of you.
LairDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSInternalNodeContext: This voice is supposed to be the same as Marcoryl, one of the druid servants.NodeContext: Urgent, a little frightened even. This voice is supposed to be the same as Marcoryl, one of the druid servants.

LairDoor.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor.text: I said go away. You people have endangered this sacred place long enough.
LairDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

LairDoor.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor.text: This door is staying closed until you're gone, one way or another.
LairDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

AD_CoweringRefugee004.speaker: Toron
