AD_BOOOALAppears.text: CUT YOU BREAK YOU TASTE YOU!

AD_GodDead.text: BOOOAL! Our Lord has been murdered!
AD_GodDead.context: NodeContext: Dismay, grief - their god has been killed

session_synopses.AD_BOOOALAppears: This line plays when we force a creature to reveal itself by overwhelming it with bloodlust
session_synopses.AD_GodDead: The Kuo-toa have found their god dead.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Hums. Clicks. Harmonies. They drift through you like an unknown language.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Then, visions. Dark dwarves - duergar - chopping fungal tendrils with their axes.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*the dark intruders broke our peace. they killed our young*))

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*we laid waste to many. others remain*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You see another vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision can be a simple linear pose to pose transition, portraying a single action

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Do you truly wish to do battle with a great warrior?
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but insistent.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*the Rot festers. duergar remain. lakeward*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The sovereign's song halts as it measures your might.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*I will reward. you cleanse the Rot. you destroy them*))

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*I sense your resolve. you will find duergar invaders near lake's edge. cleanse the Rot. destroy them*))

session_synopses: Main dialogue with creepy myconid sovereign. He wants you to kill some duergar that are left from when they attacked these mushroom creatures. Myconids are part of a "circle", kind of a hive mind. They speak in visions, with music - all telepathically. This should be otherworldly and slightly disturbing.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_01: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_03: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is taking his turn.

02.speaker: Mirthis
02.text: Drugnin' Nere - glad you offed him. Ain't no one divides the clan and lives to tell the tale.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: So those mushrooms can raise the dead? That's... interesting.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Handy magic, that. Maybe it'll be of use to us.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can find a few NPCs that have been raised by the myconoid to work as their servants. The party comments on this through a VB.This can fire on any character, and since it is not a result of direct player actions, the replies can be fairly opinionated.Can take one or two speakers.

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*
Looted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Surveying a group of Skeletons clad in Dark Justiciar uniforms (in game objects exist).

Looted.speaker: Player
Looted.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *You immediately recognise the symbol of your Lady. You know these uniforms.*

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, an honorary order within the priesthood of Shar.*

Looted.speaker: Player
Looted.text: I hope whatever killed them is still around. I will not have it soil Shar's name.

Looted.speaker: Karlach
Looted.text: Be careful what you wish for, soldier.

session_synopses.Looted: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

session_synopses.Companion: Short dialogues with this character after you have your main dialogue with him. He doesn't talk much, hasn't been the same since a rock slide.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Knock yourself out. But don't come begging for coin if you find him.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: If you try to ransom him to me, you'll find yourself skint and stuck with a fat old lout.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign.text: I'll have no part of this.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*it is my right. it is my right!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign.text: *Its delicate harmonies turn to scrapes and scratches.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the servant's face and body. Through music and vision, the sovereign reveals its origins.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *You see a frothing duergar, axe drawn, crazed by bloodlust, bearing down on a young myconid.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *The frightened myconid circle conjures mildewed vines. They encircle and transform the duergar.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *It now belongs to the circle. It will obey the sovereign.*

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: *Your mind is a canyon, and the words echo from every crevasse.*

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone.text: I don't know who you are, but you're not welcome in my head.

AD_Myconid_005_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_Myconid_005_Combat.text: ((*cut the blight away. watch it wither*))

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *The corpse twitches in response to the spell...*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_002.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_002.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: No need for me to ask how you fared - some of my kin have already made it here, safe and sound.
InjuredGnome.context: NodeContext: A little more relaxed than we've seen her - eyeing us up and impressed with what she sees

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: It's past time we were back in the city. But if you find yourself there, call on us. The Ironhand Gnomes are good friends to have.
InjuredGnome.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation +1NodeContext: Impressed and grateful. On the mend

InjuredGnome.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome.text: What will you do when you return?

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: Like I say, we Ironhands make good friends.

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: But bad enemies, too. Some folk are about to be reminded of that.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: You return. Have you changed your mind about the ring?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: How do you survive? Don't you need... brains?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: In the beginning, I had an arrangement with a lich. Excellent company, despite what one would expect.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I required brains, he required souls. A perfect symbiosis.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: But our ambitions eventually splintered. I wished to better the world, and he preferred its rot.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: So I left his company, and thus I now feed from those who... act against the Society's goals.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I cannot change my appetites. Although I am experimenting in reducing them with magic.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Perhaps with time, it can be one brain a year instead of one a month...

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: There's no trusting a mind flayer. Attack.

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: ((*no - no. I feel the faerzress... fading...*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: *You recall the faerzress - the energy of the Underdark. The myconid might die if isolated from it.*

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: Dismiss the myconid and move forward.

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: ((*I will refresh myself near Spaw's Circle*))

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_003: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_005_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_002: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence teleapthically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome: STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences.Second half - she's weary but recovering.Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power.Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Leave: You try to leave the underdark with your myconid companion, and he's having none of it.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: You had our backs. Guess you True Souls ain't all bad.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: I mean, still don't like ya. But you're not a total gobshite. Bah. You buying?
Camp.context: NodeContext: Said roughly but with a tough of affection. 'Bah' cause greymon doesn't like talking about FEELINGS.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: Come back any time. I'll be here - enjoying the show.
Camp.context: NodeContext: Pleased at the grym scene before him

session_synopses.Camp: Default dialog for the captain of the raft at the duergar camp. In default state, he encourages you to talk to the sergeant, as he has already told you to do that in previous dialogue.

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*the Circle is cleansed*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Derryth Bonecloak, a dwarven alchemist from Baldur's Gate who came to the Underdark along with her husband, Baelen, in search of a rare and valuable mushroom - the noblestalk.

FollowUp.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
FollowUp.text: I'll be damned. Nere's gone and kicked it.

session_synopses.FollowUp: The player sided with Nere, but Nere died in combat. Thrinn announces her plan: to travel to Moonrise.

PAD_RecogniseStashLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_RecogniseStashLocation.text: Looks like the place the Dark Justiciar's letter mentioned. But where's the stash?

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.speaker: Player
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.text: Must be in one of these chests.

session_synopses.PAD_RecogniseStashLocation: The party has read a Harper's letter and has arrived where they expect their stash to be.
session_synopses.PAD_KnowStashIsHidden: Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird.--------When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Looking into the hole, you see only darkness. It's impossible to tell how deep it goes by sight alone.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hellooo?

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your call echoes as it plunges downward, before gradually fading away.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The call echoes down the hole.

node_data.speaker: Voice from the Deep Hole
node_data.text: *Growl.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: This is the growl of an unseen creature deep down in the Underdark. Exactly what it is will remain a mystery, other than it sounds big, threatening and unappreciative of the player's noise-making.NodeContext: SFX only

session_synopses: A deep hole in the Underdark that you can click on and shout "Helloooooo" into, hearing an echo. Something growls from down below in response; if the player can speak with animals, you may get a disgruntled reply. The creature is unseen, but sounds large, aggressive and very unhappy at being disturbed.First speaker is added for ease of scripting. 2nd speaker is the creature.

PAD_Reaction.speaker: Player
PAD_Reaction.context: NodeContext: Facing off against a large monster that's just burst out of the ground. Said with focus and determination, rather than fear.

session_synopses.PAD_Reaction: The bulette appears for a second time in the Underdark and is going to attack the players. Said with focus and determination rather than fear.

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: Don't want to move rocks. Too much pain, too much noise.

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: No more. No more pain, no more work. All must die!

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: No! Too much yelling, too much pain. All must die!

Rothe_001.speaker: Player
Rothe_001.text: Give in to your rage and avenge your pain. Don't strike us all, just your masters.

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: Yes. They made the pain. Now they feel it!
Rothe_001.context: NodeContext: She's been egged on by the player to attack her duergar handlers.

Guard_003.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003.text: Fantastic work. You're a right master of beasts.

Guard_003.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003.text: But ain't no one but clan need to be using the forge back there - and we can't have you blabbing!

RotheDeadAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RotheDeadAttack.text: The hell's wrong with you? Drugnin' hoon!
RotheDeadAttack.context: NodeContext: Clan-sen: like it sounds. (Diuergar of another clan) Drugh = fuck. DROOG. (RHymes with hood, not food.)

RotheDeadAttack.speaker: Player
RotheDeadAttack.text: Don't get surly with me. Those beasts were out of control.

RotheDeadAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RotheDeadAttack.text: Shit-for-brains. All that adamantine within reach - and you done screwed me over!

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: You tryin' to grab the adamantine back there for yourself?

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: The metal and forge are the clan's - Laduguer's decree!

RubbleAttack.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack.text: What in the hells? What's this all about?

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: Adamantine is precious, jargh. And I'm not the sharing type.

session_synopses.Rothe_001: Animal dialogue - a skittish beast of burden.A deep rothe that's being used by some duergar to clear rubble - only it smells death and is unwilling to work. The player can try to calm the beast (through Speak with Animals or Animal Handling) and encourage it to calm down and return to work, or to turn against the duergar. If the player fails to calm the rothe, it will turn on both them and the duergar.
session_synopses.Guard_003: A coarse and unempathetic duergar, one of three guarding some Deep Rothe (beasts of burden currently being used to clear rubble).Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.RotheDeadAttack: Duergar attack you after you have angered and killed the rothe.
session_synopses.Guard_001_Dead: SwD with the Taskmaster in the Fearful Rothe situation. He might tell you about an ancient forge lying further inside Grymforge.
session_synopses.RubbleAttack: Duergar dialog that happens if the player attacks / destroys the wall  by fearful rothe.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Angry trills and tremors shake your skull - cries of anguish to its mycelic god.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Stop, STOP!
node_data.context: NodeContext: In a loud, panicked whisper.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Bibberbang!
node_data.context: NodeContext: A warning of nearby danger

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *He's indeed surrounded by bibberbang - the spores of those mushrooms are both toxic and flammable.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the name - bibberbang, a mushroom that releases dangerous spores. Highly flammable.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Surely you can navigate around some fungi, can't you?

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Please! Your help!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent. He's basically standing in the middle of a mine field of sorts.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Scroll - escape! My bag! Please. I've dropped it - somewhere!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent. He's basically standing in the middle of a mine field of sorts.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hold tight. I'll find your bag.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Thank you. Thank you!

session_synopses: Baelan, a mushroom hunter,  is surrounded by dangeous Bibberbang mushrooms. He was trying to get to the Noblestalk mushroom, but one of the stone ledges collapsed underneath him and he fell down. His partner Derryth (Dwarven Alchemist) is in the Myconid Village. Important: Baelan seems to have trouble keeping his train of thought - he loses track of his responses, changes the subject and generally seems out of sorts at times. Later, it will be confirmed that he's been suffering from a dementia-like condition for some years now.
session_synopses.Dead: Baelen was out hunting Noblestalk when he was trapped in a field of explosive mushrooms. He's now dead - most likely because the player triggered those mushrooms to explode. He speaks in short, cryptic fragments from beyond the grave.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: I know this design - Shar's faithful wield crossbows like these.

session_synopses.PAD: The player realises that a crossbow found in Ketheric City is not Dueargar make. If they pass a history check, they recognise it as Sharran.

session_synopses.MyconidDrow_Dead: Xargrim is one of three drow wizards who was looking for the Adamantine Forge. Friends turned rivals, these wizards each compete to find the forge, trying to steal the knowledge of the others as they go. Xargrim ambushed one of his fellows and set a spectator on him, but the strain of the ritual killed him.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: Thou hast come. Hee. Hee. Hee-HEE!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *The amulet is heavy, but holds a subtle warmth, like it was left under the sun.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *Suddenly, the metal surges with heat. You feel great power and an overwhelming urge - to laugh.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet.text: Grit your teeth. Summon your god's wrath.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *You know a fury more beautiful, more devastating than any. It wraps you in a comforting embrace.*
Thou hast done well. For what is a laugh, if not one step toward madness?
Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee. Thou art the one!
Return me, take me home - and thou shalt glow with blessings!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *Lines and arcs are etched into the metal, but you see no pattern in them.*

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *A giggle almost erupts from your throat. This moment strikes you as terribly funny.*
Mine curse hast become thine. Hehe hehee - alack!

ResistMadness.speaker: Player
ResistMadness.text: Stifle the strange sense of glee.

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *The joy fades as quickly as it came.*

session_synopses.EquipAmulet: When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).
session_synopses.ResistMadness: Player has left the camp. A few moments later, they are overcome with an unnatural sense of cheer. If they fail the check, they will fall over in laughter every time they use the amulet's special power that day.The madness has several levels.

002.speaker: Ward Pistle
002.text: You don't need nothing I've got.

001.speaker: Ward Magmar
001.text: Shove off. Just 'cause you offed Nere doesn't mean I'm sharing.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *Alcohol - an odd vice for duergar, prone to triggering ancestral memories of brutal illithid enslavement.*

session_synopses.002: Surly female duergar, lazy and trying to live the good life using her gnome slave. This dialogue occurs after she and her companion have ordered the duergar around.
session_synopses.001: One-liner for duergar thug. He tells you to leave after speaking previously. You get a passive skill check that may relate how alcohol can cause bad memories for duergar, and then ask about it.

node_data.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
node_data.text: You ain't clan - you got no business here.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.NodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard. He is seated with the duergar elder most of the time.

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

session_synopses.03: Pissed off duergar raider who is standing guard while the gnomes are digging up a collapsed tunnel. He is cursing his superior, saying they should just let him suffocate. The player can make use of this and threathen the duergar, saying they will tell the sergeant unless the duergar gives them money.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Be welcome in this house. I wait for your commands.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: The robot talks to a new person he hasn't talked to before while in peace mode. He bows.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

Automaton.speaker: Gale
Automaton.text: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: An unbeknownst command that I cannot fulfil.

AD_GaleEntrance.speaker: Gale
AD_GaleEntrance.text: A wizard's tower is his sanctum, a private place for research and respite. But as this wizard's not home - I say we take a peek.
AD_GaleEntrance.context: NodeContext: At first solemn/reverential. Then delighted you're about to snoop around.

session_synopses.Automaton: This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!
session_synopses.AD_GaleEntrance: Gale enters the Arcane Tower for the first time
session_synopses.CINE_PowerCutscene: This is a pure cutscene cinematic dialog. After player activates the main generator in Arcane Tower by placing a Sussur Flower in it, there should be a camera flyover showing how all the tower teleport platforms activate, lights turn on, etc.This dialog can be easily triggered from console with    SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_ArcaneTower_MainPowerOn

session_synopses.Spider03: Followup with spiders after they kill their sister Xanta.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Shadows - thick as a duerro's skull. Sucks the breath right out of your lungs.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Go on up, if you fancy. Me? I'd sooner take a swim in the Darklake.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Player
Mutineers.text: You want my gold? Then you'll have to fight me for it.

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

Rothe_01.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_01.text: *The rothé chews slowly, its eyes drooping from exhaustion.*

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: Hold up, jargh. Y-you ain't just walking away.
RebelsExtort.context: NodeContext: Aggressive in their words, but something hesitant. They're afraid of you, they just don't want to show it.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: You got Brithvar chopped - and I still haven't seen a damned coin for my trouble.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: You owe - what's the word? Restitution.  ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: That, or - or I add your corpse to the heap. Which is it?

RebelsExtort.speaker: Narrator
RebelsExtort.text: *You sense hesitation. The duergar talks tough, but fears you.*

RebelsExtort.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort.text: You've got this backwards. You keep your head, and I pay you nothing.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.Rothe_01: This younger rothe is trying to rest, but is afraid from the older one's story.
session_synopses.RebelsExtort: In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.
session_synopses.Mutineers_FollowUp: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.

PAD_InteractingWithOrb.speaker: Player
PAD_InteractingWithOrb.text: Something's off. Pure shadow - around me, inside me.

session_synopses.PAD_InteractingWithOrb: The character voicing feeling the presence of Shar when interacting with a Sharran artefact used to gain Darkvision.

Squad_Sniper.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper.text: You'll want to speak with Gekh.

Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.text: Die, so your carcass can rise!

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

DeadDuergar_Dead.speaker: Shattered Duergar
DeadDuergar_Dead.text: Hunter... reaver... warrior of... the Absolute...

session_synopses.Squad_Sniper: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.
session_synopses.DeadDuergar_Dead: The corpse of a duergar follower of the Absolute, who was part of a group sent to hunt down an escaped deep gnome slave in the Underdark. This duergar died after encountering some myconids - sentient fungal creatures with telepathic powers.

SurvivalCheck_PAD.speaker: Player
SurvivalCheck_PAD.text: Bloodied tracks - quite small, too. A gnome found some trouble here.

session_synopses.SurvivalCheck_PAD: The player identifies Thulla's tracks to be that of an escaping gnome if they pass a survival check

node_data.speaker: Skickpit

CaveIn.speaker: Skickpit

session_synopses: Skickpit has a foul mouth to match the duergar. He runs their errands for them and brings them drinks. You can ask if he wants freed, attack him, or leave him be.
session_synopses.CaveIn: Elevator gnome one-liner if you sent him to be with the others after the mutiny.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spitting in between words, enraged

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: I offer to parley, and he brings a spectator? Twit. Quite ruined my ambush.

Wizard.speaker: Player
Wizard.text: I'm more concerned with this 'twit' who set a spectator on you.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: Pah. A rival - a mere footnote to my legend. You should be more concerned with who I am.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: I am Dhourn. Third son of House Ba'Tol, first rank evoker, and initiate of Gravenhollow's...
Wizard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)NodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: ... my crystal. My memory shard. Where is it?
Wizard.context: NodeContext: Rising panic as he can't find an item we stole from him.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: You think it clever to steal from a statue, do you?
Wizard.context: NodeContext: To us, with suspicion and fury

session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.Wizard: Drow Wizard that has some info about the Adamantine Furnace.Paranoid after being petrified by the spectator.narrative feature: Used to kill his oponents and interrogate them afterwards (Disguise Self + Speak With Dead).

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

session_synopses.PAD: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

node_data.speaker: Drar
node_data.text: This ain't a show. Go make yourself useful or get lost.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standign guard, loyal to The Absolute.

AvatarWorsens.speaker: Narrator

AvatarWorsens.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pained grimace. Gale's netherese orb is weakening himInternalNodeContext: Gale gets worse for the second time. He has consumed one magic item but that has proven insufficient.

session_synopses.AvatarWorsens: Gale Avatar - after having journeyed for a while, Gale feels weak from the bomb that exist in him.

AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.text: Gonna add your ears to my collection once you're dead!

session_synopses.AD_Goblin_00: Goblin is standing in ruined cottage, fiercely protecting what meagre loot they've found.
session_synopses.AD_Boss: A goblin is scouting the village looking for loot, weapons, something of value
session_synopses.AD_Subordinates: Frustrated goblins searching a derelict building, finding little. They're bitter they can't be getting drunk in camp with the others.
session_synopses.AD_BossAndSubordinate: Goblins scouting an abandoned village-- boss is tired of his subordinates.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinsLooting: Frustrated goblins looting an empty derelict buiilding

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: Fezzerk does the talking here. Bother him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are rotating him around for their amusement.The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using the amulet of the Conquering God as a way to convince the goblins,  if they took it from the priests in the wilderness. GnomeGobllin2 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. He doesn't have much to say; either snarling threats or grovelling to those who intimidate him (drow, in this case).

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: I've got the plans and the sussur bark. Now I need somewhere to craft it all.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: The forge at the blacksmith's house should do.

AD_ForgeWeapon.speaker: Player
AD_ForgeWeapon.text: There's still life left in this old thing.

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

session_synopses.VB_TakeSussurSap: Voice bark: player takes sussur sap from a tree. SUSS-er. Needed to make a special weapon.
session_synopses.AD_ForgeWeapon: The player clicks on a forge. What they say depends on how much of the recipe they have collected. They can make a fancy weapon with the right ingredients.
session_synopses.PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined: After the player places the sussur bark he will react to it. If they know about the plans they will say to use one of the three weapons. If not they'll say that maybe they can do something with the forge.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: Wait! Please - don't leave us. What should we do now...?
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Clingy. The cult novice pleads for orders from the player, whom he believes to be a superior.

Cultist002_Dead.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_Dead.text: Brynna... a faithful... servant to... the Absolute...

session_synopses.Cultists: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.
session_synopses.Cultist002_Dead: Novice Brynna, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, is dead. Here, the player casts a spell to grant limited and temporary resurrection for the purpose of questioning her. From her, they can learn more about the cult's hierarchy, specfically the meaning of the 'True Soul' rank that is frequently referred to. Her ability to communicate after death is limited - cryptic, broken or repetitive answers to a small range of questions. If she recognises her killer, she can refuse to answer or else lie.
session_synopses.AD_OwlbearCubResolution: Two cult novices, believing you to be their superior, react to your decsion to spare a wild anima.

VB_Mirror.speaker: Player
VB_Mirror.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. They just detected something strange that they can't put their finger on.

session_synopses.VB_Mirror: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player notices something odd about a mirror, but they can't quite figure out what (they're in fact detecting the energy of a magical trap that resides within the mirror).

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Look what we got here - another little birdie wantin' to fly!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk notices us and calls out to his cronies. (The line is addressed to the goblin raider and scavenger, but Fezzerk's attention is broadly held by the player.NodeContext: Cruel bravado.The goblin sees the player approach and boldly announces it to his cronies - he thinks some fresh victims have just turned up.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Yehehueh! Flap those wings some more, an' I'll feed you a worm!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.NodeContext: Greatly amused. A schoolyard bully tormenting the little kid. Projecting his voice a little (Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.)
'Yehehueh!' = Fezzerk's distinct laugh (a raspy, mean-spirited slur of a laugh)

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: An' you - hope you got a stomach fer heights!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin turns back to the player (if the gnome inclusion line triggered - otherwise he's facing the player the whole time.)NodeContext: Confident, unpleasant. Turning his attention to the player to deliver a threat.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm not looking for trouble - just want to pass by.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Heh, funny. That's what our birdie wanted.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking. Refers to the player's previous statement ('I don't want trouble - just want to pass by').

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: ...Release me this instant, you beasts!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Context - the deep gnome yells at his captors as he swings into earshotNodeContext: Panicked, angry. Issuing an ultimatum even though he has no means of following through on it.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: 'Less you wanna join him up there, you'd best pay the toll.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin looks at his hands and tries to calculate a figure with his fingers.NodeContext: Fezzerk mockingly refers to the deep gnome's predicament as he threatens the player. 'Passing by' refers to rotating on a windmill rather than safe passage through the area, in his book.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Cough it up! ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The idea is the goblin is a bit dim greedy and throwing out a stupidly high number.NodeContext: Fezzerk declares his price. (A ridiculously high sum - questionable whether he truly knows how absurd a demand this is)

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm going to pay nothing, and you and your cronies are going to leave.
True

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Y-you're a True Soul... I didn't know. Wouldn't dare question you, never!

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: We'll, erm, we'll leave you to it.

AD_InvestigateMill.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill.text: Why's the spinnymajigger stopped? Get it moving again!
AD_InvestigateMill.context: NodeContext: Impatient and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive has stopped - their leader wants his cronies to investigate and get the windmill working again.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.text: Look's like the fun's over. C'mon, let's see who else we can snatch.
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.text: Fezzerk... best raider... east o' the... Sea o' Swords...
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are watching him spin around. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using a cult symbol of authority as a way to convince the goblins, if they have it. FOR_GnomeGoblin_1 (Fezzerk) is the leader of the goblins and does most of the talking. If the player is a drow, the goblins will be much more nervous and easier to intimidate. At times, the captive goblin pipes up from the windmill, loudly pleading or berating his captors.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigateMill: Some goblins tormenting a gnome tied to a windmill are surprised when it stops rotating.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.
session_synopses.Dead: A speak with dead dialogue with a slain goblin, Fezzerk. As he's been just temporarily resurrrected from the afterlife, he speaks in slow, cryptic, fragmented phrases. From him, the player can gain a little insight into their hostage-taking activities. If Fezzerk recognises the player as his killer, he won't speak at all.

003_Dead.speaker: Edowin
003_Dead.text: Edowin... a True Soul... a Chosen...

session_synopses.003_Dead: True Soul Edowin has been killed by an owlbear. This is his corpse speaking. He is concerned about his siblings and still devoted to the Absolute.

AD_Plead.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: mocking barcus as he (barcus) flies on the windmill pane.

AD_Plead.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: Calling down to a goblin who has him captive on the windmill. Said while spinning on windmill.

AD_WaitingForRelease.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_WaitingForRelease.context: NodeContext: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well - get on with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Get on with what?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I'm a deep gnome, you're a drow. You helped me, now you plan to enslave me.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That's not what I want.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: What, then? Torture? Bloodsport? Or perhaps just a good old-fashioned walloping?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You owe me nothing.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I could extort you, if that's what you want.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: You're teasing me now. I'm certain of it.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.text: Come on! What are you waiting for?!
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: The gnome grows exasperated and panicky over the player's delay in cutting him free.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp.speaker: Player
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

session_synopses.AD_Plead: Fezzerk the goblin calls up to his captive, Barcus Wroot, who is being spun on the blade of a windmill, mocking his efforts to attract help.
session_synopses.AD_WaitingForRelease: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether
session_synopses: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.
session_synopses.AD: If the player gets the windmill to stop spinning, then clicks Barcus, Barcus will get these lines. Barcus will be impatient, mistrustful of the player, but still in need of player's help.
session_synopses.TiedUp: The player has stopped the windmill from rotating and can now cut Barcus Wroot, the captive gnome, free from its sails. They can do this immediately, or else demand payment first, much to the gnome's frustration.
session_synopses.AD_RotatingFasterReaction: Said while being spun faster on the pane of a windmill. Should be in a panic.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeFreed: After being let off the pane of the windmill.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

PAD_WebWarning.speaker: Player
PAD_WebWarning.text: Better be careful - those webs carry vibrations.

session_synopses.VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance: The player finds the deep pit leading to the underdark.
session_synopses.PAD_WebWarning: PAD when seeing webs. Either just complaining about the fact that the spiderwebs are everywhere, or realising touching them could be dangerous.
session_synopses.VB_EnterNest: The player sees the gigantic spider in the spider nest.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A feast fit for an ogre. You notice a peculiar dagger protruding from the tough, leathery meat.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grasp the handle and pull the dagger with all your might.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You tug at the dagger until the blade snaps in two. The sharp end is still stuck inside the meat.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.speaker: Player
PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.text: A prayer sheet. What's this symbol on it?

PAD_NoticeStashSeal.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeStashSeal.text: There's magic keeping this chest sealed; I can feel its aura.

PAD_TriggeredTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_TriggeredTrap.text: Agh! This thing won't yield its contents easily...
PAD_TriggeredTrap.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a moderate jolt of pain.

PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite.context: NodeContext: Hushed awe. A good omen from their goddess.

session_synopses.PAD_PickupPrayerSheet: The player comments after picking up an old prayer sheet. They may or may not recognise that it could help them unlock a magically sealed chest.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticeStashSeal: Following a passive arcana check, the player comments that a chest discovered at a shrine has a spell cast over it, protecting its contents.
session_synopses.PAD_TriggeredTrap: The player reacts to a magically-locked chest injuring them upon attempting to open it without disabling the protections.
session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite: A Selûne-worshipping player manages to unseal a magically locked chest after reading a prayer.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: No talk, only bite! Go to goblin leader for talk.

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

LastCub.speaker: Narrator
LastCub.text: *The cub looks from you to his dead mother.*
LastCub.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cub looks from dead mother to the player, wailing.NodeContext: Narrator node!

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You feel the quake of its heavy footsteps before you see it: an owlbear, its beaked face looming out of the darkness.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: This greeting if the player doesn't have Speak with Animals.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: *Growl.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ready to pounce.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Study the owlbear's behaviour.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The owlbear's one good eye flicks away for a moment. You follow its glance...*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The owlbear glances over

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *...and see an owlbear cub.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cub is highlighted.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Move toward the cub.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A bloodthirsty screech erupts from the owlbear's throat.*

AD_HatchedEgg.speaker: Player
AD_HatchedEgg.text: Owlbear eggshells... an unhatched one would fetch quite a price...
AD_HatchedEgg.context: NodeContext: Speaking from knowledge or experience. The player recognises the egg they've spotted and the price that an intact one could fetch.

session_synopses.LastCub: In SwA, this cub speaks in short bursts - he sounds staccato, vicious.The player has killed an owlbear - a large, predatory wild animal. The owlbear's cub remains however, and lingers by his dead mother. The player can decide whether to put the cub out of its misery, or else leave it. If the player has the speak with animals skill, they get some additional insight into the cub's anxiety. If the player lets the cub live, it will proceed to eat its mother - it's still a wild animal, after all.
session_synopses: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - the voice of a seasoned fighter, at home in a fight and used to winning. However, she knows she's injured and at a disadvantage, but refuses to betray that to the player. Doing so might encourage the player to attack, putting her cub in danger.The player stumbles upon the nest of an owlbear; a large, predatory hybrid creature. They find themselves in a stand-off against the beast - if they get too close or act aggressively, it attacks. If they keep cool and back off when the opportunity presents itself, the owlbear will let them leave. The player may also notice that the owlbear is wounded - a broken spear protrudes from one eye socket. They may notice that the owlbear has a cub - this is the main reason for her aggression and territoriality.Additional note 1: the player may stumble upon this scenario by themselves, or they may have been pointed in the right direction after meeting some cultists who had a close encounter with the owlbear. If we won these cultists over, they may be available to fight the owlbear at our side.Additional note 2: If the owlbear mother is killed but her cub survives, we can decide the juvenile's fate. If we spare it, we may later find it being used for sport by the goblins in their camp.
session_synopses.AD_HatchedEgg: The party reacts to coming across some large empty eggshells, from an owlbear. They may recognise the species, or may have already picked up an intact egg.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Weapon blueprints. A master blacksmith's work.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The inking is rough - a work in progress, surely.

session_synopses.PAD: Players see plans at the workstation where Sampson used to clear his head.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: We're, eh, working hard for Absolute. Hope you spare a good word for us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Servile

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to windmill sail and are rotating him for their amusement. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possiblyby using their mind-influencing powers or otherwise convincing the goblins they're on the same side. GnomeGobllin3 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. She's abrupt and aggressive to most, though servile and meek if the player happens to be a drow.

AD.speaker: Chock
AD.text: Dwarf better. Dwarf sweet like honey.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Must you? This inane chatter pains me.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Oh, for... shut mouth! Head hurt!
AD.context: NodeContext: He is exasperated. Then he speaks in typical ogre speak.

session_synopses.AD: Three ogres have a meal time discussion. Chock and Fank are stupid. Lump is smart.

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog grows more aggressive

session_synopses.Dead: Using Speak with Dead, we are able to talk to the spirit of Gomwick. He was killed by a band of gnolls, but managed to save his dog, Scratch, by forcing him to flee.
session_synopses.Dog:
In SwA, Scratch speaks like a human. He doesn't have any kind of dog-like affectation, nor is he stupid - he's well-spoken, even when he's saying 'dog' things. Throughout the dialogue, he's stoic but heartbroken, deluding himself into believing that his master is not dead.We come across the corpse of a man being protected by his loyal dog, Scratch.The dog refuses to let us near the dead man or his belongings, forcing us to try and win him over (or else just kill him). We can use Speak with Animals to get further insight into the dog's perspective.
 If we cast Speak with Dead upon the courier, we can learn the dog's name and use this as an additional way to win it over.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you approach, a guttural scream and a succession of quick bangs rattle the door.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Then a low moan. Someone - or something - is having a bit of fun.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Open the door.

node_data.speaker: Grukkoh
node_data.text: Ngh. W-what the hells are you doin'?
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: A look of surprise and facination stretches across the player's face.
Offscreen the couple notices us, the camera catches them scrambling off as quickly as possible.NodeContext: Still busy with his ogress at first, then realises someone entered.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack the couple.

session_synopses.AD_OgreKilled: The players have killed the ogress (the bugbear's lover) and he swears revenge.
session_synopses.AD_BugbearKilled: The players have killed the bugbear (the Ogress' lover) and she swears revenge.
session_synopses: The player arrives at a house and hears a strange noise inside. It might sound like a fight is happening inside, but upon closer inspection they can learn that a bugbear and an ogre are making love.
session_synopses.Ogre_Dead: Butthir the ogre has been killed - you are now speaking with her corpse.

VB_OwlBearPrints.speaker: Player
VB_OwlBearPrints.text: Looks like a beast came through here - a big one too.
VB_OwlBearPrints.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Spoken in reference to a large set of animal tracks they've spotted.

session_synopses.VB_OwlBearPrints: The player discovers a large set of animal tracks. They may be able to identify them as those of an owlbear.

ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.speaker: Narrator
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.text: *This fight could have been avoided, but now you've made it inevitable.*
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.context: NodeContext: Hostile. A pre-combat utterance potentially spoken by any goblin or worg at the windmill

session_synopses.ApproachedUnfortunateGnome: Rather than openly approaching the goblins/worgs near the windmill, a player snuck by and then gets spotted once they're near the windmill. Combat starts immediately.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: The House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
Dinner.context: CinematicNodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.NodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Are you not entertained? Well - far be it from me to disappoint.

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Mocking a gnome that's spinning on an windmill.

VB_BookDestroyed.speaker: Player
VB_BookDestroyed.text: Well done. The world's better off without it.

session_synopses.VB_BookDestroyed: Companion reaction to the player destroying the DangerousBook ('The Necromancy of Thay'). This book was clearly magical, whispering offers of dark power. You destroyed it by dropping it on the ground and blasting it with radiant damage. When you destroyed it, there were some spooky vfx. Most characters would see this as a good thing. Gale, Astarion wanted the book for themselves, however.

AD_Crack.speaker: c1a1d9d2-d3b5-49fc-ad48-9312552c7caa
AD_Crack.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only - wood creaking and snapping under strain.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record

session_synopses.AD_Crack: SFX only. A tree trunk bridge across a ravine groans and creaks under the weight of the player as they walk across it. Two seconds after this sound is heard, it'll collapse entirely.

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Goblin Warrior
CheckpointGuards.text: 'Allo and welcome to Bogrot! Now, kindly - giz all your stuff.
CheckpointGuards.context: NodeContext: A goblin's closest approximation of courtesty, faintly mocking. He's loudly welcoming you to the town he has dubbed 'Bogrot'

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuards.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

PatrollingGoblin.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin.text: Mind the ogres, your drowsiness. They don't got no respect.

session_synopses.CheckpointGuards: This goblin is guarding the entrance to a town his squad have occupied. The residents are long-dead, the town abandoned, and so he's taken it upon himself to rechristen the village as 'Bogrot'.
session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.
session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin: A goblin is patrolling around the abandoned village on the lookout for intruders. He doesn't want to be bothered.

BridgeSign.speaker: Player
BridgeSign.context: NodeContext: Reading a signpost. Elturel pronounced 'ELL-tur-ELL'. Baldur pronounced 'Ball-dur'

EmptyMindflayerPod.speaker: Narrator
EmptyMindflayerPod.text: *An empty mind flayer vessel. If its occupant survived, they're nowhere to be seen.*

session_synopses.BridgeSign: Sign near a stone bridge linking the Druid Grove to the Ruined Village. Establishes where the player is in relation to the city of Baldur's Gate. After reading this, natives of the city may pass comment, noting that they know broadly where they are now.
session_synopses.EmptyMindflayerPod: Players encountered an empty pod in forest.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Blood everywhere. This camp was ambushed.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: No ordinary creature did this. Redcaps ripped the place to pieces.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for HAG. The player comes across a wrecked campsite that is covered in blood and clearly abandoned. Passing a Nature check reveals the culprits to be redcaps.

HagLair_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
HagLair_Victim_003.context: NodeContext: *With a gasp, the corpse shuddered.*

AD_ControlledByMask.speaker: Player
AD_ControlledByMask.text: Get out. GET OUT OF MY HEAD!
AD_ControlledByMask.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clutching head NodeContext: Panicked and afraid as the hag invades your mind. Lae'zel's line; Pa'vrylk = Stop! Pronounced; PAH-vrill-ck

AD_ControlledByMask.text: Quiet, little one. Auntie will make it all better.
AD_ControlledByMask.context: NodeContext: Soothing and cruel. A vicious insult as you take over their mind.

Lair.text: You come to my home, interfere in my business, and now have the gall to face me in the heart of my lair? You petulant bollocks.
Lair.context: NodeContext: This begins the fight. Roaring it at the player - likely on the other side of the lair. They've freed your captive and you are furious and out of blood. Fit to kill everyone in the room.

Lair.text: I'll rip your spine out your arsehole.
I'll use your blood to spice my stew.
I'll keep you alive until I've sucked the marrow from your bones.
And then I'll bring you back and do it all over again.

MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist.text: Yes, Auntie. I'll break their pretty little bones.
MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist.context: NodeContext: Wearing a mask that controls her - at this point, it's commanded her to kill the player and she revels in what she's going to do

MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, trying to resist telepathic commands from the hag who is ordering them to kill the players in combat

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2.text: Why is Auntie so quiet? I'm scared.

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim2.text: Don't be afraid. I'm here to help - I need to remove the mask.

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2.text: There is no mask - leave me alone!
